Job Title: Procedural Supply Chain Analyst - Hospital of University of Pennsylvania
Job Description:
Description

Penn Medicine is dedicated to our tripartite mission of providing the highest level of care to patients, conducting innovative research, and educating future leaders in the field of medicine. Working for this leading academic medical center means collaboration with top clinical, technical and business professionals across all disciplines.

Today at Penn Medicine, someone will make a breakthrough. Someone will heal a heart, deliver hopeful news, and give comfort and reassurance. Our employees shape our future each day. Are you living your life's work?


Summary:



The Supply Chain Analyst will improve the efficiency of supply chain operations through data collection and analysis. The Supply Chain Analyst's primary responsibilities is to support HUP Supply Chain, analyze data to maximize supply chain efficiency and assist in cost control. The position requires excellent attention to detail, in-depth understanding of the delivery process and exceptional analytics skills. Support decision making by the department through retrieval and analysis of business data. Serves as a resource to the department for the operation and functionality of information systems. Facilitates compilation and validation of information thus maintaining integrity of databases.
Receives work assignments from the HUP Procedural Director of Supply Chain. Works independently to design, test and prototype reports, models and analyses, as well as work with users through sign-off and implementation. Accommodates the requests of Periop / Supply Chain management, as well as generate ideas for reports that will allow for users to understand, predict, and enhance Supply Chain processes.

Responsibilities:



Provide primary analytical and reporting support to all HUP Supply Chain areas.
Reporting automation using Windows/PowerBI Scheduler, Excel, EPIC Optime and Lawson tools.
Reassess current work for opportunities for improvement in efficiency and accuracy.
Analyze information, compare and contrast both internal and external comparative databases and benchmarking information.
Utilizes large complex data sets to meet functional and non-functional business requirements.
Data mining / reporting to examine Supply Chain business processes.
Optime data mining to examine variances in surgical procedure supply utilization.
Comprehensive knowledge of Lawson AP & MM applications.
Ability to normalize, manipulate and interpret clinical and purchasing data.
Recommends to HUP Procedural Director of Supply Chain cost-effective alternatives.
Building PowerBI / Excel dashboards and automating end-to-end PowerBI /Excel reporting.
Excel to include complex formulas i.e. V Lookups, Pivot Tables, Charts and Graphs, MS Access, WordWork with various partners such as SDS, IS, Data Science, etc across the system to design, develop, and maintain various reporting capabilities.
Ability to express technical information clearly and simply to non-technical people.
Determine areas in which master databases can be created to reduce redundant queries. Ensure data is accurate and reflects current business processes.
Provide support for ad-hoc projects, by building queries and creating data sets. Ensure ad-hoc data is consistent with business processes.
Provide technical counsel to co-workers and staff.
Establishes strong working relationships with Supply Chain / Periop leaders and staff.
Resolves cost messages as needed for restricted buyers.
Pinpoint areas in which databases and reports can be automated.
Maintains Item Master, templates, and contract data.
Provides feedback to the Manager on team member performance to support annual performance reviews.
Updates vendor files, catalogs, remit to information, etc.
Catalogues new items accurately and in a timely manner.
Works with Inventory team on newly requested items for adding to the Item Master.
Supply Chain analysis identifying and solving problems through data analysis.
Managing projects/requests from requirement gathering to final delivery to the end-user.
Working knowledge of data analysis and forecasting tools and ability to develop actionable insights from data.
Proficient in spreadsheet applications, SQL analysis tools and mathematical analysis.
Provides technical and analytical guidance and expertise.
Responsible for sharing their ideas and findings with internal stakeholders through both written and verbal communication.
Acts as a restricted buyer to support the flow of good and services when staffing demands.
Maintains quality customer service skills between team and customers (departments and vendors)
Preserves confidentiality, privacy and dignity of patients, visitors, vendors, etc., according to UPHS or departmental policy Cooperates with, and demonstrates respect for, all hospital services and personnel
Provides or facilitates in providing a clean, safe, quiet and secure hospital and/or business environment for all
Performs telephone activities in a courteous/professional manner Maintains composure, good judgment and acceptable work performance under conditions caused by deadlines, workload, situational crisis, opposition or other causes.

Education or Equivalent Experience:



Bachelor of Arts or Science (Required)
Or 8+ years Demonstrated Supply Chain, Information Systems or Business experience.Education Specialization: Information Systems, Supply Chain, Business or similar field of study or relevant work experience.

We believe that the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. Our employee benefits programs help our employees get healthy and stay healthy. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits program that includes one of the finest prepaid tuition assistance programs in the region. Penn Medicine employees are actively engaged and committed to our mission. Together we will continue to make medical advances that help people live longer, healthier lives.

Live Your Life's Work

Job Summary
Responsible for analyzing, organizing, and developing requirements that drive the development of technology products and services. Working closely with Product Managers and Product Development, this position focuses on ensuring that products being delivered provide meaningful value to users and customers, additionally partnering with Product Readiness and Product Operations to ensure adoption and efficiencies. The Business Analyst will also review business processes, assist with root cause analysis, and provide process recommendations. Frequent independent judgments are essential. The incumbent is also required to perform all tasks in observance of Rite Aid’s brand and strategy and adhere to our core values and service attributes.
Job Responsibilities
Gain a deep understanding of initiatives, their business problems and solution design, in order to act as a translation layer to the development team, enabling execution and adoption.
Serve as the subject matter expert for products within assigned product line(s), providing input into the product roadmaps and business cases being developed for new initiatives.
Work closely with Product Managers and Development to coordinate development efforts to address requirements identified in strategic initiatives and projects.
Work with business owners, Product Managers, and Product Readiness to ensure proper requirement documentation, including those required for system acceptance and adoptability.
Manage the assigned product backlog, ensuring the best next thing is queued for development based on strategic priorities as set by leadership, and working with Product Operations to manage maintenance and support request development.
Provide input into product release strategy and planning, including potential impact to timelines and clarification of user needs.
Participate in business and industry workgroups, driving meaningful input into product roadmaps.
Assist Product Operations to complete root cause analysis and identify corrective actions.
Work with internal departments and/or customers to evaluate and recommend opportunities for configuration and supportability of products.
Adhere to both internal and industry best practices and productivity metrics.
qualifications

Education and/or Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Arts/Sciences (BA/BS) health administration, information technology, business or related field required.

5 years of experience in software product development or business analysis, or 3 years' experience if related Masters or other advanced degree completed required.

5 years of experience in pharmacy benefit management or relevant healthcare experience .

Core Information
Job Title : Sr. Analyst, Data Steward;Job Code : Sr. Analyst, Data Steward (BA00P406);Job Family : Business Analysis;Created By : Function : Business Analysis;FLSA Status : Exempt;Job Level : P4;Travel Type: National Domestic; Travel Amount: up to 25%
General Purpose of Job
This role will be a member of a small Finance Data Strategy team in Corporate Finance supporting Financial data environments and interfaces covering specific business areas in Finance (Investment operations, Actuarial, EPM data, Financial reporting, etc) This senior level analyst will be responsible for cleansing, aggregating and analyzing data for specific use cases along with identifying data trends and insights. This resource will act as one of the key process experts who understands how to standardize, manage, and advocate for best-in-class data. Will support the Data Governance activities within Corporate Finance with relationship ties to governance resources in other areas of the business. This position will initiate and support the company's Data Governance and Data Management program throughout the organization.
What you'll be doing
o Managing analytics projects from start to finish (data integration, analysis, reporting).
o Working closely with the team leads to solve statistical business problems.
o Perform assigned analysis activities related to business requirements for data environments as well as mapping analysis for source to warehouse needs.
o Developing and coding new algorithms to meet specific business needs.
o Carrying out statistical research, prototyping new systems, and finding new ways of gathering, cleaning, and analyzing data.
o Managing, maintaining, data elements in assigned data environments for Finance areas
o Consulting with internal and external teams to determine their ongoing business needs & data requirements, and to find solutions to them.
o Ability to lead teams in researching or solving business-critical problems.
o Support data governance initiatives
o Support the system of record as a "single-source of truth" for each data element; ability to manage a group discussions or individual research to resolve multiple sources of truth issues with key stakeholders via clear definitions of elements.
o Support management, categorization and capture of data.
o Cleary communicate and liaise with multiple business units and support teams across the global enterprise on complex data governance projects.
o Work with managers to define & manage the Data Governance Roadmap, including enterprise wide Data Quality Framework and an Information Model
o Facilitate bi-directional communication of strategies, priorities and issues
o Works with the business units to ensure data ownership and quality, and with information technology to ensure data security
o Champion organizational behavior change as it relates to the use of data; realizing vision of data managed as an asset
o Work with Data Architects to ensure facilitation of consistent data quality control and optimization
o Work with business teams within finance to define and implement processes to assure data quality for business purposes
o Meet with Finance teams to develop and maintain business data quality requirements and specifications
o Independently drive intermediate to advanced metadata documentation, data lineage, data transformation rules in support of key program deliverables.
o Participate in the creation of data models (e.g. design and population)
o Perform testing and validation of requirements an/or data management capabilities
o Create detailed test strategies and test plans
o Perform complex root cause analysis and resolution of business data issues
o Perform other duties as assigned
What we’re looking for
4+ years of experience in data mining, data analysis, data management, data governance, data stewardship, or data quality at a financial institution or in another highly regulated industry. (Required)
4 Year/Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience (4 years of experience in lieu of Bachelor's) (Minimum Required)
3-5 Years of experience in the Insurance Finance industry that aligns with the specific responsibilities of this position
Experience with SQL
Experience with cloud querying tools a plus
Working knowledge of visualization tools (tableau, PowerBI, Quicksight)
Ability to understand data metadata management practices
Ability to clearly articulate thoughts and ideas and adjust communicate based on audience
Ability to leverage previous experience to consider a variety of alternative to arrive at a timely, practical and effective solution to resolve business problems.
Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work with business partners to design and execute priorities and project goals.
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle shifting priorities
Demonstrated understanding of overall data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules,
Strong experience with Accounting, Finance, and EPM system implementations / data

We’re seeking future team members for our 2024 BNY Mellon Analyst Program - Engineering (Data Science) with roles located in Pittsburgh , New York , and Lake Mary in hybrid positions.

Program highlights:

The 2024 BNY Mellon Analyst Program - Engineering (Data Science) aims to develop and retain high-potential entry-level technology professionals who are prepared and positioned to contribute to the successful execution of BNY Mellon’s technology strategy and initiatives.

Data Science

Apply scientific methods to find solutions to real business problems.
Perform data analysis, feature engineering, and advanced methods to prepare and develop decisions based on data.
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Provide insight into observed business outcomes through analytics.
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies in data.
Automate data analysis and streamline analytical processes
Provide recommendations based on data trends uncovered when possible
Stays abreast of organization and management changes and has in-depth knowledge of company practices relevant to data science products.
Grow and develop skills across the 3 domain specialties: Machine Learning, Feature Engineering and Advanced Analytics capabilities. Stressing expertise in the core functional areas: Computer Programming, Math & Analytic Methodology, Distributed computing, and communications of complex results

Program Eligibility/Qualifications:

Must be enrolled in an accredited university/college pursuing bachelor’s degree or a 4+1 program in a relevant field (i.e., Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a similar major with extensive Data Science, Statistics, or related fields.) Graduating by summer 2024.
Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above
Does not require sponsorship for employment visa status (now or in the future) in the region where applying

Preferred skills:

A great attitude and desire for learning
Excellent problem solving, written and oral communication skills
Disciplined self-starter, capable of working independently or in close collaboration
Smart and driven individual who is passionate about learning new technologies
0-2 years of experience in software development preferred. Previous technology internship is a plus

Job Title: Channel Integrated Marketing Analyst III- Distribution
Job Description:
The Channel Integrated Marketing Analyst will implement content and production processes (internal and external) to ensure world-class quality, brand, and business unit alignment with TE authorized distribution channel partners. The Channel Integrated marketing analyst will support content authors across multiple business units, in creating high-quality content on TE.com and other communication platforms. This role requires highly analytical, data-driven skills and capability to understand how to optimize programs to deliver upon overall company goals and metrics. Excellent communication skills, a tactful diplomatic and convincing approach, creative problem-solving skills, and an ability to understand and respond to customer needs in a changing and challenging business environment are required.




This role will work with multiple Business Units across the Transportations Solutions (TS) – specifically Automotive, Industrial and Commercial Transportation, Application Tooling and Sensors. It will serve as critical partner across others segments to achieve business growth in distribution and strategic Indirect Growth Marketing team model.


What your background should look like:




Internally:

Coordinate with Business Units to ensure Channel roadmap is complete and accurate along with coordination with Integrated Marketing to include newly created channel relevant content all to be included in monthly email to distributors.
Work closely with Business Units for Annual Repromotion programs, track and analyze results vs target, interpret marketing data to create insightful reports to guide decision-making and build required action plan.
Develop marketing plans for and with our Channel Partners for key growth initiatives and product launches, including leveraging data & insights to drive segmentation, target identification, persona development and value propositions.
Work closely with Business Units, Key Account Managers and Channel Sales Enablement team on annual channel planning process to maximize co-op funds allocation as per Transportation Solutions Business Units priorities. Be a representative and defender of Transportation Solutions Channel Integrated team for transition & implementation.
Be Transportation Solutions ambassador in Distributors & Business Units reviews to provide feedback on marketing activities implemented based on annual plans. Present results of distributors partners activities / promotions to illustrate insights, enable decision-making and hold Channel Partners accountable.
Leverage cross-BU promotional opportunities with distributors outside of BU focused campaigns and priorities to gain TS product and application exposure.
Identify opportunities to improve Channel Marketing effectiveness through improved marketing processes, tools, and overall customer experience.
Work on TEOA process to improve processes through Channel marketing playbook and other tools to provide a better internal experience and clear overview of TS Integrated Growth marketing vision and value.
Balance multiple concurrent assignments with shifting priorities across a shared resource pool in a fast-paced and high-volume environment.
Provide guidance that’s in-line with TE’s governance model, digital best practices, and brand alignment to support Distribution Reviews for co-op’ marketing activity.
Populate Ready Set Go Template with provided content & images.
Pocket Pack Sample Ordering for on demand channel program.
Campaigns: this role will require to work with Transportation Solutions Integrated campaign team to run 1 or 2 campaigns launched in the year that consists in Co-developing and implementing integrated marketing programs aligned with specific Business Units growth objectives (which may include all elements of the marketing mix).



Externally:

Centralize, share, and discuss approved annual distributors plans with our distributor’s partners and Key Account Managers to align, and collaborate closely with them and other segments counterpart to provide a one TE experience and campaigns / promotions readiness.
Participate in reviews, influencing and negotiating, when necessary, push Transportation Solutions Business Units marketing priorities, timeline, deadlines, content, etc. Collaborate closely and regularly with them to implement the approved annual plans.
Own tactical activity in support of business unit application campaigns and product marketing activities with TE Distribution partners including coordination with other integrated marketing activity. Coordinate and track progresses from the implementation to the results.
Ensure with the Key Account Managers, NPI readiness by our partners to maximize the demand and promotion.
Track, review and analyze data related to digital channel performance, web distributor analytics and page performance.
Skills, Experience and Education
BA/ BS degree in Marketing or related technology field with experience in technical writing
2 / 3 years of integrated marketing experience in a B2B or technology company with a heavy focus on distribution
Gather insights from our distributors partners to influence Business Units plans and enable a faster path to growth revenue.
Achieve engagement and commitment from identified partner(s) for clear GTM plan, metrics, and tracking.
Strong team leadership skill and exercise discretion and independent judgment.
An innovative thinker and creative problem solver, ability, and willingness to challenge the status quo.
A convincing communicator with compelling perspectives and knowledge of marketing trends and innovations.
Highly analytical, data-driven and understands how to optimize programs to deliver upon overall company goals and metrics.
Exceptional written, verbal and presentation abilities – clear and concise.
Proven effective negotiation and influencing skills (internally and externally)
May coach and train other employees on some specific channel processes and requirements to support and provide a better understanding.
Develops solutions to a variety of complex problems and Outside the Box thinker.
Passion for technology.
Project management experience.
Computer proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams) a must.
Experience with SalesForce.com, Eloqua, and other digital marketing tools a plus.

Competencies
Values: Integrity, Accountability, Teamwork, Innovation

Compensation:

Competitive base salary commensurate with experience: $90,200 – $135,200/year (subject to change dependent on physical location)
Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. TE Connectivity reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the experience/qualification of the selected candidate as well as internal and external equity.
Total Compensation = Base Salary + Incentive(s) + Benefits

Job Title: Quality Control Analyst – Lane to Back Office(Toll data)
Job Description:
Data-Core Systems a consulting, services and digital transformation solution provider helping businesses reshape their future with cutting-edge technologies and services, has an immediate opening for a Quality Control Analyst – Lane to Back Office in the Consulting Services Division.


Our client has an immediate opening for a Quality Control Analyst. Our client is a roadway system and as a part of their digital transformation they are implementing a solution based on SAP BRIM & Microsoft Dynamics CE. The new solution being developed will need a testing strategy and plan. The testing will span all components being developed in the following applications: Microsoft Dynamics, Microsoft Power Platform & SAP. Your role involves providing expertise and guidance in the development and execution of a testing plan spanning all the above-mentioned platforms for the new roadway system that is being developed, ensuring that the streaming high volume “lane to back office” data integrity is maintained.


Duties & Responsibilities:




Design and manage the testing efforts, bringing best practices involved with testing the roadway system implementation
Review, provide input, and ensure accuracy with detailed project documentation including RACI, test plan, traceability matrix, and test schedule
Be an advocate of Quality Assurance, Continuous Improvement and industry recognized Best Practices
Build, implement, and champion quality assurance principles and maintain the quality of delivery
Review business requirement and functional specification reviews by reporting any inconsistencies or insufficiencies related to testing
Assist with activities in the test plan to ensure that all the objectives are met, and that the solution works as expected
Ensure procedures are followed with a high degree of quality in creating user stories, tasks, test cases, and bugs
Actively track quality assurance metrics, by preparing queries and reports using ADO functionality
Provide feedback for production deployment readiness
Provide oversight and leadership to the team working on the quality control for the roadway system implementation project



Required Skills:




Experience in software quality assurance on the following platforms: Microsoft Dynamics, Microsoft Power Platform & SAP
Experience in both automated and manual testing
Experience in Unit Testing, System Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing, and Performance Testing



Required Education and Experience:




Bachelor’s Degree
7+ years of experience in implementing a roadway tolling system
12 years of experience as a Quality Analyst



We are an equal opportunity employer.

The Business Analyst will be involved in all aspects of the Development Lifecycle (SDLC) taking part as the consistent and knowledgeable focal point throughout projects. You will supply support for projects, enhancements and break fix efforts including keeping business units apprised of the progress of key efforts. You will work within projects teams consisting of business and IT staff, as well as consultants and offshore testing and development resources.

In support of business operations and systems, the Business Analyst will identify problems, diagnose, find root causes, and either solve issues or coordinate resolution with the IT and Operations teams. This is a hands-on position that requires subject matter expertise in the business functions supported by the application.

Responsibilities:

Develop strong working relationships with business users and external partners and become knowledgeable about how the business unit’s function, with the objective of being able to recommend and define process and systems improvements.
Gather requirements and create documentation to be reviewed and approved by IT and business unit management.
Review, analyze and evaluate business user needs and develop requirements for projects and enhancements that are consistent with overall business and IT strategies.
Evaluate project requests by working with business units to understand, articulate and communicate project scope, costs, and benefits.
Recommend and specify process and systems improvements through analysis of system incidents, bug fixes, change requests.
Conduct analyses to investigate on-going or one-time operational issues.
Create and manage project plans, monitor project progress by tracking activity, identifying, and remediating project risks, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions to keep projects on schedule and within budget.
Work alongside development teams to ensure full and accurate understanding of business requirements and specifications. Perform functional walkthroughs as needed throughout the development process.
Develop test plans and specific test cases based on project requirements and systems specifications. Ensure the traceability of discrete requirements and specifications through structured documentation and test plans/cases to ensure proper test coverage.
Coordinate testing phases of projects tracking errors and fixes and ensuring proper regression testing of any effected system elements.
Develop user acceptance test plans and partner with business units through the successful completion of user acceptance testing (UAT).
Actively take part in the implementation of process and system changes including attendance at regular change management meetings and involvement in deployments and any post-implementation check out activities.
Update and develop system and user documentation.
Participate in user training sessions as needed.

Requirements:

Proficiency with project management software packages (i.e.: MS Project, Asana, JIRA).
Expert level knowledge of MS Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Excellent analytical and documentation skills.
Detail oriented and focused on constant improvement in personal skills.
Ability to work independently and within a team framework.
Well organized with strong time-management skills.
Experience developing enterprise web applications leveraging responsive design for mobile devices is a plus.
Working knowledge of marketing automation platforms and CRMs (Salesforce) is a plus.

Education/Experience:

The ideal candidate is preferred to possess a bachelor’s degree in an appropriate field of study (including business analytics, computer systems or information technology) or 6 to 10 years of equivalent work experience.
Proven experience in all aspects of a full SDLC acting in the role of Business Analyst with QA responsibilities or Project Manager.
Must have excellent verbal communication, written communication, and social interaction skills.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance

Experience level:

2 years

Ability to commute/relocate:

Philadelphia, PA 19103: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

SQL: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Philadelphia, PA 19103

The Data Analyst is responsible for understanding business requirements and designing data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights. They will be responsible for designing data pipelines and infrastructure, developing reports and dashboards, interpreting data, and communicating to technical and non-technical audiences. The individual in this role must be analytical and resourceful, have excellent communication skills, and can work directly with end users and stakeholders.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Develops professional-quality business intelligence, data visualization, and analytics content in support of OSIS’s strategic priorities, using Power BI and Crystal Reports.
Provide Subject Matter Expertise (SME) support in common functions of the BI technologies including reporting, analytics, analytical processing, data transformation, and data.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements, such as automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Optimizes performance and usability of Power BI reports and dashboards by tuning queries, implementing efficient data models, and applying best practices.
Collaborates with business stakeholders to understand their requirements, translates them into technical specifications, and designs efficient and visually appealing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Provides a high level of internal and external customer service.


REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

BS degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience
Minimum 2 years of demonstrated experience developing accurate, effective, and appealing visualizations using Microsoft Power BI.
Knowledge of Power BI application security layer models
Proficient in SQL, T-SQL, and SQL Server Management Studio
Strong Knowledge of DW architecture and ETL frameworks
Understand relational Database concepts, including normalization and query optimization


PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Experience using Azure Data Factory (ADF), building and managing data pipelines to enable the flow of data into an Azure-based Enterprise Data Platform
Experience developing reports with Crystal Reports
Familiar with Azure DevOps, Agile development, and Git


TELECOMMUTING AND TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This position is a remote role.

Must have:
Cable or Fiber Internet Service
Download speed of 20Mbps or higher
Upload speed of 5Mbps or higher

Workplace Flexibility: Field

Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.


Olympus, a leading medical technology company, has focused on making people’s lives better for over 100 years.

Our Purpose is to make people’s lives healthier, safer, and more fulfilling.


Our Core Values are reflected in all we do: Integrity – Empathy – Agility – Unity – Long-Term View


We deliver on our purpose and our core values by staying True to Life.

Job Description

The Senior Business Analyst is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) that will play a pivotal role in transforming, organizing, and continuously improving quality system processes and information managed through global systems and tools that support the Quality Management System at Olympus. This role focuses on providing management insights, visibility, and governance to the quality system globally. The SME will collaborate closely with global project teams to ensure the fulfillment of stakeholder requirements. They will assist Global Process Owners (GPO) and the Project Management Office (PMO) in project management efforts to maintain schedules and ensure task completion. The role will be responsible for translating business needs into requirements, facilitating user validation, conducting end-user training, authoring system and process documentation, performing data analysis, and actively engaging with stakeholders.

Job Duties
Serves an as subject matter expert, understanding business requirements and technical capabilities of the business system tools to be developed or in use.
Conduct in-depth analysis of existing business processes, systems, and data to identify areas for improvement.
Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to extract, clean, and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to inform decision-making.
Collaborates with business users, internal technology teams across Olympus and vendors to establish and prioritize business and technology requirements.
Leads gathering and documenting business requirements with stakeholders globally.
Analyses the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; from a business and technology perspective to ensure the system design fits the needs of the users.
Translates business requirements into clear and comprehensive functional specifications that are understandable to the end-users.
Change agent to facilitate effective deployment of business systems. Work with and manage complex workflows as they pertain to business process.
Assists in the development of validation documentation (i.e., IQ, OQ, PQ, and UAT).
Provides training, guidance, and is a resource support for end users.
Supports defining project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements.
All Other Essential Duties as assigned by Management.
Job Qualifications

Required:

BA/BS medical, engineering, scientific discipline.
5 years of related experience analyzing, clarifying, and translating business requirements into functional and technical specifications.
Experience supporting or working within a pharma, medical device, or any other regulatory controlled industry.
Background and familiarity with U.S. FDA QSR, requirements including ISO 9001, MDD 93/42, ISO 13485-2003, and Canadian Medical Device requirements.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques (e.g., SQL, Excel, data visualization tools); Competent understanding of International medical device regulations.
Competent with Microsoft Office 365 Suite, Visio, Adobe, DocuSign, Agile and Windows platforms.
Global working hours.


Preferred:

Black Belt / Green Belt, Continuous improvement techniques and/or demonstrated problem-solving and root cause techniques is a plus.
Industry certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA) are beneficial.
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving driving proactive solutions.
Knowledge of business application testing approaches.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
A motivated self-starter that is able to work independently and in teams on tasks and projects with limited supervision.
Project management experience is a plus.

Overview & Responsibilities
PURPOSE OF THE JOB
The principal reason for existence of the job is to perform analysis of market and business unit data at corporate level for Elliott Group.
The job assists in the analysis and presentation of market and business-related data for the strategic planning activities of the Elliott Group. This position works in collaboration with the Sr. Manager of Corporate Strategic Planning and with the business units/product lines.
Market outlook and forecast for strategic corporate planning is 3-10 years into the future and business unit/product line outlook is in the 1–3-year period.
The job is instrumental in helping to identify and quantify changes in global market conditions, customer requirements, competitor behavior, and threats/opportunities.
This job will compile, analyze and report strategic business financial and market related data.
The job supports the Sr. Manager of Corporate Strategy in the analysis and development of growth opportunities including mergers and acquisition (M&A) or corporate partnerships.
BACKGROUND and EXPERIENCE
The job requires a minimum of five to seven years of work experience in strategic analysis in the manufacturing and/or service industry.
An understanding of financial, marketing, industry, global business structure and operations is expected. M&A experience is beneficial.
Product knowledge of industrial equipment or turbomachinery is preferred.
It requires the ability to understand global issues, analyze data, propose solutions,
Must have demonstrated capabilities in financial analysis and strategic development.
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Engineering).
Able to handle spreadsheet/graphic/word processing and internet software.
Comfortable working with minimum supervision
Self-starter with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and solve problems.
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
SPECIFIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIES/COMPETENCIES
Experience in due diligence activities for mergers and acquisitions
Strong understanding of corporate finance
Experience with different valuation methods (including DCF, comparable public companies, and other M&A transactions)
Excellent interpersonal skills, including ability to communicate clearly and concisely both orally and in writing.
High attention to detail
Self-starter with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and solve problems.
Superior analytical, quantitative, and critical thinking skills
High level of personal integrity, as well as the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity.
Monitor, evaluate, and report information pertinent to business.
Support and develop presentations for the business on strategic topics and market/business intelligence analysis.
Understand market dynamics, competitive landscape and economic drivers for growth.
Conduct or assist in conducting market research studies on specific topics related to the business.
Support development of investment business cases, as it pertains to achieving strategic goals.
Support operational activities and requests, including resourcing, reporting, planning, and leadership presentations,
Collect and analyze market segment and customer research data to identify and prioritize market trends, new applications, new customers, strategic alliances, strategic business partnerships and potential mergers and acquisitions.
Participation in exhibition, conference or forum type of event to investigate short to long term market trends

Job Title: Neuroimaging Data Analyst Junior (Department of Neuropsychiatry)
Job Description:
University Overview
The University of Pennsylvania, the largest private employer in Philadelphia, is a world-renowned leader in education, research, and innovation. This historic, Ivy League school consistently ranks among the top 10 universities in the annual U.S. News & World Report survey. Penn has 12 highly-regarded schools that provide opportunities for undergraduate, graduate and continuing education, all influenced by Penn’s distinctive interdisciplinary approach to scholarship and learning. As an employer Penn has been ranked nationally on many occasions with the most recent award from Forbes who named Penn one of America’s Best Large Employers in 2023.
Penn offers a unique working environment within the city of Philadelphia. The University is situated on a beautiful urban campus, with easy access to a range of educational, cultural, and recreational activities. With its historical significance and landmarks, lively cultural offerings, and wide variety of atmospheres, Philadelphia is the perfect place to call home for work and play.
The University offers a competitive benefits package that includes excellent healthcare and tuition benefits for employees and their families, generous retirement benefits, a wide variety of professional development opportunities, supportive work and family benefits, a wealth of health and wellness programs and resources, and much more.
Posted Job Title
Neuroimaging Data Analyst Junior (Department of Neuropsychiatry)
Job Profile Title
Programmer Junior
Job Description Summary
Neuroimaging Data Analyst Junior

The Shanmugan Laboratory is part of the Department of Psychiatry, the Neurodevelopment & Psychosis Section, and the Lifespan Brain Institute (LiBI). Our goal is to personalize early interventions in reproductive psychiatry. To do this, we use non-invasive neuroimaging and advanced computational methods to understand mechanisms underlying sex differences in psychopathology and identify neuroendocrinologic markers of risk vs. resilience for psychiatric disorders. The Neuroimaging Data Analyst Junior will provide support for managing and analyzing data.
Job Description
The Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania is the oldest and one of the finest medical schools in the United States. Penn is rich in tradition and heritage and at the same time consistently at the forefront of new developments and innovations in medical education and research. Since its founding in 1765 the School has been a strong presence in the community and prides itself on educating the leaders of tomorrow in patient care, biomedical research, and medical education.
http://www.med.upenn.edu/
.
Neuroimaging Data Analyst Junior
The Neuroimaging Data Analyst Junior provides support for managing and analyzing neuroimaging data. Analysts play a central role on large-scale projects that seek to understand sex differences in brain development and the biological basis of hormonally-driven psychiatric symptoms. Within these projects, they work in a team environment with a diverse, multi-disciplinary group of faculty and trainees from psychiatry, psychology engineering, statistics, and computer science. Primary responsibilities include management, processing, and analysis of high-dimensional imaging data. Additional responsibilities will be assigned based on the successful candidate's skills and interests. All analysts additionally lead independent projects (i.e., meta-analyses of neuroimaging studies) where they write first-author manuscripts.
Qualifications
The ideal candidate has a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Statistics, or Computational Neuroscience, and 0-1 years of research experience or equivalent combination required.
To succeed in the highly collaborative environment, excellent interpersonal and communication skills are required. Program and data analysis skills are strongly preferred, including Python, linux/bash, and R. Experience with neuroimaging tools (SPM, AFNI, FSL) is preferred but not required.

Background check required. Position contingent on funding.

Working Conditions
Office, Library

Physical Effort
Typically sitting at a desk or table; Occasional lifting 25 lb. or less
Job Location - City, State
Philadelphia, PennsylvaniaProgrammer Junior
Department / School
Perelman School of Medicine

$20.45 - $32.00 Hourly Rate

Time Away from Work: Penn provides you with a substantial amount of time away from work during the course of the year. This allows you to relax, take vacations, attend to personal affairs, recover from illness or injury, spend time with family—whatever your personal needs may be.
Long-Term Care Insurance: In partnership with Genworth Financial, Penn offers faculty and staff (and your eligible family members) long-term care insurance to help you cover some of the costs of long-term care services received at home, in the community or in a nursing facility. If you apply when you’re newly hired, you won’t have to provide proof of good health or be subject to underwriting requirements. Wellness and Work-life Resources: Penn is committed to supporting our faculty and staff as they balance the competing demands of work and personal life. That’s why we offer a wide variety of programs and resources to help you care for your health, your family, and your work-life balance.

Not only do Penn arts and cultural centers and museums offer free and discounted admission and memberships to faculty and staff. You can also enjoy substantial savings on other goods and services such as new cars from Ford and General Motors, cellular phone service plans, movie tickets, and admission to theme parks.
Flexible Work Hours: Flexible work options offer creative approaches for completing work while promoting balance between work and personal commitments. These approaches involve use of non-traditional work hours, locations, and/or job structures.
Penn Home Ownership Services: Penn offers a forgivable loan for eligible employees interested in buying a home or currently residing in West Philadelphia, which can be used for closing costs or home improvements.

An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

Familiarity with Student application support/development.
Demonstrated understanding and technical grasp of relational database design/normalization, testing methodologies and software development lifecycles.
Familiarity with installing/upgrading software on Windows servers and following best practice protocols.
Strong analytical and testing skills
Strong knowledge of software architecture
Demonstrated ability to elicit and document user requirements and to document completed applications.
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills along with the ability to relate to a diverse group of management and staff.
Strong interpersonal skills; able to build strong relationships with clients and team members.
Ability to lead and deliver major project initiatives on time and as expected.

Suggest improvements to existing applications.
Be able to apply time management skills and manage your own projects with minimal supervision.
Document and share status of projects.

Familiarity with Student application support/development.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst with PMP Certification
Job Description:
Position: Senior Business Analyst

Location: Harrisburg, PA

Duration: 6+ Months

The Department of Labor & Industry desires an experienced Senior Business Analyst to help oversee multiple ongoing Information Technology enhancement projects supporting the DLI Vocational Rehabilitation, Central Services, Labor and Safety Management (VCL) division.

This engagement requires staff interaction with agency program areas, potential vendors, and EBR (IT) Delivery Center. Prior experience in Software Development and Implementation is required. Familiarity with Project Management methodologies and/or managing & tracking a project against a project plan is also a plus.

Incumbent will work closely with the assigned Division Manager/Project Manager and must be able to help coordinate activities, staff schedules, and support the Division Manager/Project Manager in keeping the projects on track and on a very strict timeline. The incumbent may be required to assist with small tasks to ensure project is on schedule and suggest or coordinate corrective action if it is behind schedule.

Incumbent must be organized, self-motivated, able to meet deadlines and capable of working on multiple tasks at one time. Must also be able to effectively communicate, verbally, in writing, or via electronic media, and facilitate collaboration across the full range of executive, business, and technical resources. Incumbent will also be closely aligned with requirements gathering, validation testing, and developing training materials.

The incumbent must have advanced business analytical skills, leadership abilities, and be able to perform the following activities:

Perform Business Process Reengineering (BPR) including assessment of existing business processes (As-Is Assessment), determination of future state (To-Be Assessment and Requirements), and Gap Analysis
Facilitate Joint Application Development (JAD) or Detail Design Sessions (DDS) facilitation
Document business process requirements and process diagram flows, review business policy and procedure documentation, create/update documentation as needed and review with business partner and IT administrator resources
Engage as Liaison between business partner agency and information technology (IT) staff including Project Manager and internal/vendor development staff. Possess the ability to interact with various staff levels including senior executive managers.
Collect, analyze, and document business requirements, business rules, processes, and legislation and generate functional and system requirements documentation required for system development.
Plan and coordinate overall testing efforts to include test plan, creation, and execution of test scenarios for system integration testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Orchestra coordination and execution of Training Plan including development of training materials, quick reference guides, and standard operating procedures manuals.
Use specialized software (Team Foundation Server) for creation and management of system application documentation, tracking system changes, tracking reported bugs, creation of Test Plans, Test Suites, Test Cases
Ensure compliance with all applicable Commonwealth information technology policies and EBR-DC guidelines, security, and related standards.
Analyze legislation or other business documentation to determine any necessary IT system or business process changes that are required.
Ensures proper escalation to appropriate management of issues and potential project risks including compliance risks or limitations of available information technology services risks impacting development completion or impacts to schedules
Other related Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) activities related to the Business Analyst functions.

Work may also include leadership activities of lower-level team of resources used in the completion of project related objectives. Those activities include but are not limited to:

Advise/guide assigned staff involved in documenting business process as requirements within and across multiple business areas, review business policy and procedure documentation, create/update documentation as needed and review with application developers for code development.
Lead lower-level business analysts and assigned contractor staff ensuring completion of project tasks and maintain status tracking of related tasks against project timelines.
Participate in the performance evaluations of subordinate business analyst and assigned contractor staff work consistent or organizational requirements, as appropriate.
Oversee contractor staff assigned to tasks regarding the analysis of legislation or other business documentation (i.e., RFPs) to determine necessary IT system changes or changes to business processes required to meet the objectives of an agency initiative.

Job Title: Sustainability Analyst I, II, or Sr.
Job Description:
Overview:
Philadelphia Gas Works

Looking for a challenge and ready to power up your career?

Free Health Insurance Options– Free Dental Insurance – Flex Spending - Commuter Benefits - Pension Plan – Free Parking – Wellness Programs – Onsite Gyms – Tuition Assistance- PSLF Eligible Employer- Parental Leave- Hybrid Work Environment

The Philadelphia Gas Works (PGW) is the largest municipally-owned gas utility in the nation, supplying gas service in the City of Philadelphia to over 500,000 customers. From its humble beginnings in 1836, PGW has grown into the large, modern facility that exists today. As one of the nation's leading natural gas providers, PGW prides itself on stability and continual growth. PGW is dedicated to becoming the Greenest Natural Gas Delivery Company in the region.

Become part of the PGW Team!

Sustainability Analyst I: Will perform research and analysis to support the development of PGW’s sustainability practices, policies, programs, and strategies. This entry level incumbent will work under direction to conduct research, and analyze data.

Sustainability Analyst II: Will work independently and collaboratively to conduct research, analyze data, and develop strategies to continuously improve PGW’s sustainability performance.

Senior Sustainability Analyst: Will work independently and collaboratively to conduct research, analyze data, develop strategies to continuously improve performance, and will also help to foster a culture of sustainability through ongoing organizational communication and education.
Responsibilities:
Project Management:


Support development and implementation of sustainability programs and projects across PGW through excellence in communication, governance, and reinforcement standards.

Maintain corporate dashboard of sustainability projects with KPI’s for internal and external stakeholders.

Data Collection and Management

Collect enterprise-wide environmental sustainability data and supporting documentation for external and internal reporting needs. Identify internal and external datasets to inform research and analysis projects.

Review data sources and reporting for accuracy and completeness.

Perform data preparation for analysis. Support ongoing data collection and automation.

Develop business intelligence reporting, forecasting models, and analytical frameworks to translate data into actionable recommendations.

Develop and maintain documentation of processes and procedures around sustainability data collection and management across departments.

Develop templates, standardized reports, and scorecards for management purposes, and for external and internal reporting.

Research and Analysis

Work within Sustainability function and in coordination with other departments to execute professional research, analysis and summary reports and presentations on prioritized topics, to provide findings, conclusions, and recommendation to inform executive business decision-making related to corporate sustainability.

Perform research, collect data, and synthesize findings from external resources, including industry publications and conferences, academic research, market sources, peer benchmarking, and government reports to inform corporate business analyses and plans.

Monitor sustainability industry trends and identifies opportunities for implementation.

Finance & Accounting


Ensure timely transfer of information and help with unit operating and capital budget processes.

Help to maintain appropriate expenditure tracking systems for standard work needs and special project coordination.

Other Related Functions

Monitor and identify industry trends and support translating them into viable programs that drive the organization’s sustainability initiatives.

Participate in and support data needs for external sustainability-related programs and partnerships e.g. EPA Methane Challenge.

Support Corporate Communications in sharing sustainability initiatives internally and externally.

Perform other special projects and assignments as directed.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Studies, Environmental Engineering, Chemistry, Chemical. Engineering, Business Administration, Economics, or other related fields.

Advanced degree (Master’s) in a relevant field is preferred.

Sustainability Analyst I: minimum 1-3 years of relevant experience required.

Sustainability Analyst II: minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience required.

Senior Sustainability Analyst: minimum 5 years of relevant experience required.

Professional certification/credential in the sustainability/climate change field such as Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA), LEED Green Associate, Is a plus.

Knowledge of environmental, social and governance (ESG) reporting frameworks like GRI, CDP, SASB, and TCFD is preferred.

Must have strong analytical skills with the ability to conduct research, gather relevant internal and external information and synthesize it into a cohesive, concise presentation and / or analysis.

Must have strong organizational skills and be able to prioritize work independently, work in a fast-paced environment handling multiple projects and pay close attention to details and meet deadlines.

Experience in data mining, data analysis, financial analysis, risk analysis, and strategic marketing is preferred.

Must have interpersonal influential skills with the ability to support and encourage a sense of change through the business and assist in cross-functional and cross-departmental projects.

Must have the ability to demonstrate an ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence in the departments and be team- oriented and customer-focused.

Must have the ability to communicate persuasively and influentially, both verbally and in writing, across a broad spectrum of stakeholders.

Must have the ability to understand the “big picture” and long-term implications, as well as the short-term impacts and challenges (in short, the context) and how to achieve the strategy through tactical execution.

Must be computer literate with proficiency in the use of Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Project, SharePoint, Visio.

Experience and training in data analytics tools like Excel, Python, Alteryx, Tableau or other analytics platforms is a plus.

Experience assessing companies’ corporate sustainability goals and objectives and identifying gaps and opportunities for implementation is preferred.

Awareness of current sustainability trends and issues, particularly in the natural gas industry, is preferred.

This positon will focus on the day-to-day business operations of a signature service line within WVU Medicine. This position contributes to meeting departmental goals through identifying revenue enhancement, expense management, and project development opportunities. This position will take a lead in several business functions which include, but aren’t limited to; oversight and coordination of service contracts with non-WVU Medicine entities, project management and deployment of new tools and software systems, and monitoring, analysis, and report coordination of operational metrics key to the success of the department.

12. Participates in post implementation review of projects.

M3T Corporation, headquartered in central PA, with an additional office in Virginia, is a Veteran-Owned small business. We are an industry leader in the design, installation, and maintenance of comprehensive security solutions in the Mid-Atlantic states. Established in 2001, M3T Corporation has fostered and continues to develop its reputation as an innovative technology leader and full-service provider for customers.

The Operations Specialist: Operations & Sales Data Analyst is a detailed professional with a laser focus on projects, service and sales. This role is a career path start to step into a Project Manager, Purchasing, Sales, or Technical Services role in the future. Gathers and validates business / technology requirements to establish scope and parameters of requirements and define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics
Supports production functions, troubleshoots data and analyzes data for healthcare plans
Field tickets from business units and resolve batch job errors
Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Position Summary

Network Relations Analyst is responsible for the accurate and timely validation and maintenance of critical provider information and inquiries. Staff is responsible for timely review, response, tracking, and routing of provider inquiries received via the provider relations department email box. Works closely with both internal and external business partners to ensure provider and member issues are handled timely. Staff may be responsible for review of claims data and information. Network Relations Analyst is responsible for monthly Access and Availability monitoring as required by state regulatory requirements. Staff ensure adherence to business and system requirements of internal customers as it pertains to other provider network management areas.

Oversees receipt of and coordinates provider inquiries from the provider network and responsible for reviewing, documenting, tracking, and routing all issues to ensure providers receive a timely response and permanent resolution

Reviews/analyzes data by applying job knowledge and experience to ensure appropriate information has been provided.

Audits Rosters received in the provider relations department email box and works closely with the data team to ensure rosters submitted from providers are accurate

Oversees Access & Availability monthly monitoring process

Responsible for reviewing claims data in QNXT when provider’s inquiry involves claims payment adjudication

Conducts or participates in special projects and other duties as assigned


Required Qualifications

Minimum 1 - 2 years managed care experience


Preferred Qualifications

3+ years Provider Claims and/or Provider Network Administration experience

Experience in Medical Terminology, CPT, ICD-9 codes, etc.

Access and Excel – intermediate skill level (or higher)


Education

Associate's degree or equivalent experience

Pay Range

The typical pay range for this role is:

$43,700.00 - $90,000.00

This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.

For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit jobs.CVSHealth.com/benefits

Coventry is a specialty finance company with an expertise in life insurance. Specifically, we create and invest in insurance-based assets, and we’re the leader and creator of the secondary market for life insurance. Over the last 22 years, we’ve delivered more than $4.5 billion to life insurance policyowners.

The continued success of our company is the result of the hard work and dedication of our employees, and the continued pursuit of top candidates. We know that without the best team, we cannot be the best firm. Our organization is built on strong values designed to foster leadership and reward success. We're proud of the fact that more than 80% of our management team were promoted from within, and we strive to provide an environment supportive of career progression.

About the role:

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and reporting of various financial and non-financial data and metrics. Duties will primarily focus on development and process improvement/enhancement of the reporting of the data and metrics.

Key Job Responsibilities:

Assist in the development of key operating and financial indicators, the reporting needed to support decision making and the monitoring of performance.
Develop dashboards and reporting using visualization tools along with training and supporting business users on using the tools.
Short-term and long-term planning, modeling and forecasting for various financial and non-financial business data.
Assist in the preparation of the monthly financial reporting package and variance analysis.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree
5+ years of relevant professional experience with an emphasis on data queries, modeling, presentation and a thorough knowledge of visualization products (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Ability to work collaboratively across our organization to drive business value through turning data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Highly organized with the ability to help manage multiple project streams and complexity; propensity for thinking through projects in a structured way.
Excellent communication, analytical skills and attention to detail.

Benefits

A competitive salary commensurate with experience.
Student loan repayment program.
Training and mentoring programs.
Health, Dental, Rx and Vision coverage.
401K match.
Generous paid time off.
Company sponsored events throughout the year.
Opportunities to earn bonuses and other perks.

START DATE: IMMEDIATE OPPORTUNITY AVAILABLE

SCHOOL: Esperanza Academy Charter School

LOCATION: 4261 N. 5th Street, Philadelphia PA 19140

ABOUT ESPERANZA ACADEMY:

Esperanza means hope. Esperanza Academy Charter School (EACS) is located in the Hunting Park section of North Philadelphia and prides itself on serving the students in the community in which it is located. Currently serving grades K- 2, and 4-12, Esperanza Academy believes that education can be a vehicle for social and economic progress for marginalized communities. As a result, we are relentless in our pursuit to provide our students with the best educational option in the Philadelphia area.

Our proven track record of students who have historically been underserved sets us apart. The Academy has 11th-grade test scores above the city of Philadelphia average and value-added math and reading proficiency growth among the highest in Pennsylvania. Students graduate at a rate exceeding 90% and drop out at a rate of only 1%. For 8 out of the last 10 years, the Academy has been achieved a silver or bronze medal rating in the US News and World Report ranking of Best High Schools in the country.

By the fall of 2025, we will have fully expanded to a K-12 school serving over 2,200 students.

THE OPPORTUNITY

At Esperanza Academy, we believe in using data to drive instructional decisions that maximixe learning opportunities for ALL students. Our team is currently seeking a Data Analyst to join our team. Reporting to the Director of Student Success, the Data Analyst will support in monitoring, collecting, analyzing, and disseminating student data. This role will focus on the processes needed to allow instructional leaders to focus on instructional decision making that propels students forward. We seek a student-centered, data driven educator who is passionate about supporting positive change in underserved communities through providing timely and accurate data to inform the strategic decision making process.

Esperanza Academy shared services team members:

Are mission-minded leaders both inside and outside of the school building.
Understand that building strong relationships with all stakeholders is critical to student achievement.
Are student-centered, proactive, and maintain a high level of customer service.
Are able to make decisions that prioritize what is best for our school community.
Are collaborative team players who believe that their work helps move students forward.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS

A passion for education and a belief all children deserve a great education.
A minimum of 3-5 years of professional teaching experience in any content area.
Experience in working in an urban setting or charter school preferred.
Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and/or Googe Sheets.
A Bachelor’s Degree in Education or a related field.
Clearances: All applicants must have current FBI, PA Criminal, and Child Abuse background checks.
Spanish fluency is preferred but not required.

FOLLOW US

Job Title: Advanced Business Analyst - Any FE location
Job Description:
FirstEnergy at a Glance



We are a forward-thinking electric utility powered by a diverse team of employees committed to making customers’ lives brighter, the environment better and our communities stronger.



FirstEnergy (NYSE: FE) is dedicated to integrity, safety, reliability and operational excellence. Headquartered in Akron, Ohio, FirstEnergy includes one of the nation's largest investor-owned electric systems, more than 24,000 miles of transmission lines that connect the Midwest and Mid-Atlantic regions, and a regulated generating fleet with a total capacity of more than 3,500 megawatts.



About the Opportunity

This is an open position with FirstEnergy Service Co., a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp. [FEU]



Work location will be determined based on business needs and the selected candidate.


The Business Analyst position in Transmission Portfolio Management is responsible for the creation of project master data in SAP (work orders and WBS's) as requested from Transmission Portfolio Development or other business entities. This requires an in-depth understanding of FERC accounting, SAP cost flows, the concepts of: FE Operating Companies, Distribution vs. Transmission, Lines vs. Substations, capital vs removal vs. O&M, and the ability to determine asset ownership. The position also requires an understanding of various systems (SAP, PowerPlan, CREWS, Cascade, OPPM, etc.) to determine the correct attributes. The position will work closely with the FET Forecasting group in support of project forecasting and budgeting. This position also supports the Transmission Project Managers with project accounting and participates in accounting related activities such as determining CIAC, developing journal entries, and project close-out.


Responsibilities include:

Demonstrate commitment to the FirstEnergy Core Values and Behaviors
Ensure the accounting compliance of Transmission cost collectors
Create Transmission project WBS's and work orders in SAP
Determine correct asset ownership and incorporate in the development of the project accounting
Determine correct project accounting settlement rules relating to Operating Companies, Voltage, Capital, Removal, O&M of project accounting
Support the FET forecasting group with project accounting issues, CIAC (make the necessary system entries to ensure accurate posting), and create journal entries as needed
Support the Transmission Portfolio Development and Emerging Technology groups by creating project WBS's and work orders in SAP for projects approved in the Transmission Portfolio
Ensure that the correct WBS's and work orders are mapped to the appropriate project RPA
Run master data queries; ensure the integrity of the MasterData in SAP and PowerPlant is accurate; make the necessary modifications as required
Support ad hoc research of WBS's and work orders
Collaborate with the Transmission Business Services Group
Support of storm activities
Travel may be required at times across the FirstEnergy system


Qualifications include:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline preferred. In lieu of degree, minimum 4 years relevant work experience will be required. Relevant work experience may include financial analysis, accounting, financial reporting.
Excellent interpersonal skills, strong written and verbal communication skills
Utility accounting experience preferred
Proficient with Microsoft Office tools including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access
Demonstrated working knowledge of FE specific systems such as SAP, PowerPlan, CREWS,OPPM, Transmission GIS, Toad Data Point, UI Planner is preferred
Knowledge of FERC accounting is preferred


Benefits, Compensation & Workforce Diversity

At FirstEnergy, employees are key to our success. We depend on their talents to meet the challenges of our changing business environment. We are committed to rewarding individual and team efforts through our total rewards philosophy which includes competitive pay plus incentive compensation, a company-sponsored pension plan, 401(k) savings plan with matching employer contribution, a choice of medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, and life insurance programs, as well as skills development training with tuition reimbursement. Please visit our website at www.firstenergycorp.com to learn more about all of our employee rewards programs. FirstEnergy proudly supports workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with a disability. No recruiters or agencies without a previously signed contract. Unable to sponsor or transfer H-1B visas at this time.

Safety

Safety is a core value for FirstEnergy and is essential to all of our business activities. We ensure employees have the tools, information, and processes to perform their duties in a manner that assures safety for themselves, their co-workers, our customers and the public. Our goals are to provide a safe work environment, to maintain an accident-free, injury-free workplace, and to promote and maintain public safety. To meet these goals, we dedicate ourselves to achieving world-class safety standards.

Experience gathering end user requirements and coordinating solutions with a technical team.

Experience in creating application relevant reporting.
