Broad Overview

The pharmaceutical Trade Channels Analyst’ is responsible for managing Trade Operations and Commercial Channel Partners for the following brands: Speciality Pharmaceuticals (Spec Pharma) – CroFab, DigiFab, Voraxaze, Cyanokit, Xuriden, and Vistogard. This position reports to the Senior Director of Trade Relations.

As the Trade Channels Analyst, some of your responsibilities will include:

Manage relationships with Trade Channel Partners: Wholesalers, Specialty Distributors and Specialty Pharmacy

Manage all day-to-day activities with wholesaler distribution partners to ensure effective and efficient distribution to the end-user customer. Foster and maintain strong relationships with all stakeholders

Monitor all Channel Partner Distribution Services Agreements to ensure compliance and adherence to all terms, conditions, fees and renewal dates

Perform daily analytics and monitoring of wholesaler forward DC inventory levels, providing recommendations regarding inventory levels; track seasonal and other sales trends to ensure channel inventory is aligned with demand

Support new product launch planning activities, including coordination with cross-functional launch teams and channel partners, contracting and negotiation

Provide insight on channel trends and monitor distribution service to ensure optimal performance of all channel partners

Perform regular business reviews with all channel partners, including all performance analytics, hot topic issue management and all meeting follow-ups

Ensure ongoing training with Channel partner customer service team to ensure partner teams effectively respond to customer calls, inquiries and order requirements

Manage consignment customer requests, invoicing and all data sets; ensure accurate and timely replenishment and invoicing

Ensure connectivity with all channel partners and BTG’s 3PL for all DSCSA data; Provide Serial # scan data to channel partners for any shipment anomalies

Analysis and accurate reconciliation of all Channel Partner Invoices and creation of PO’s to ensure timely and accurate payment of channel fees.

Support Annual NABP Accreditation activities to ensure ongoing state and federal compliance for distribution licensure

Manage all Trade data sets across various vendors; Analyze Data and assist with internal reporting

Manage all Channel Partner Data Sets: Sales of BTG products to wholesalers and wholesaler sales to hospitals; Sales data through 3PL portal; EDI data through Third Party Aggregator; Excel files from Consignor Channel

Daily and Weekly reporting; Monthly management reporting; Lost Sales and Service Levels, others as needed

Provide critical analytical insights on all Trade data, orders, processes and procedures to provide insight into product performance and drive future strategic initiatives

Support end of month analytics and reconciliations for finance and other groups

Oversight of In-house Direct Product Replacement Program

Manage support team to ensure accurate and timely processing of customer replacement requests

Weekly and Monthly reconciliation reporting and analytics

Liaison with Third Party Logistics (3PL) partner as needed:
Manage and ensure resolution and follow up with any order issues

Manage any associated 3PL financial components: invoices, credits, credit limits, etc. related to Trade Channel Partners

Government Pricing and Pricing Analytics support

Verify BTG monthly/quarterly government pricing data in conjunction with internal contracts team, 3rd Party pricing vendor, and BTG finance group

Communicate list price updates to external partners and pricing compendia

Manage or assist with other ad hoc reporting as requested

Troubleshoot order issues to bring resolution:
Ensure orders filled efficiently and correctly; resolving were issues have occurred

Occasional after-hours responsibility for any just in time order resolution

Ensuring that all interactions and engagements are carried out with the highest ethical and professional standards and that all work is accomplished with quality and in accordance with Company values.

Carry out other reasonable tasks as required by the Line Manager.

The above duties and responsibilities are not an exhaustive list, and you may be required to undertake any other reasonable duties compatible with your experience and competencies. This description may be varied from time to time to reflect changing business requirements.

To be successful in this role, you should demonstrate:
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Business, Finance, or Health Sciences

Experience in the pharmaceutical industry, and previous channel management strongly desired

High level user in Excel, PowerPoint and Word

Superior analytical writing and presentation skills with the ability to present data and findings, both orally and in writing, utilizing excel and other business intelligence platforms

Outstanding customer relationship, interpersonal, and communication skills with the established ability to collaborate and effectively work with diverse audiences and influence cross-functional and multi-disciplinary teams

Understanding of EDI datasets (852,867, etc.)

Able to perform all job responsibilities in a fast-paced environment

Strong organizational and problem-solving skills

Attention to detail required

Company Benefits:
Vacation, Sick and Personal Time

Medical, Dental, Vision and other Voluntary benefits

Paid Parental Leave

Tuition Assistance

Discretionary Bonus Plan

Competitive 401(k)

S erb Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity employer. We offer competitive compensation & benefit packages, challenging opportunities and a culture of working together in a supportive way built on our strong foundation of values.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Business Analysis and Insights
Job Description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

The role involves comprehensive analysis to ensure the accuracy of information through the creation, maintenance, and evaluation of data. This includes comparing data with third-party information, budgets, or actual results, researching risks or compliance concerns, and evaluating financial data, key performance indicators, and metrics. The position also entails the organization of data-driven analysis and insights to support business strategies. This involves serving as the analytics subject matter expert, reporting data-based insights consistently, and collaborating with internal and external partners to establish a cohesive strategy for utilizing data-driven insights. The job also includes providing customer service and reporting in the designated area of responsibility, supporting key business processes, and serving as an information resource.

Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Evaluation:

Create, maintain, and evaluate data.
Compare data with third-party information, budgets, or actual results.
Analyze and research risks or compliance concerns.
Utilize financial models, plans, and tools for analysis.

Business Strategy Support:

Evaluate ongoing analytical needs.
Serve as the analytics subject matter expert.
Report data-based insights uniformly.
Collaborate with internal and external partners for strategy development.

Customer Service and Reporting:

Provide reports and communicate results.
Support key business processes.
Serve as an information resource for stakeholders.
Resolve issues, answer questions, and provide documentation.

Efficiency and Compliance:

Establish timelines, workflows, and requirements.
Support and develop training.
Manage and verify functionality of key processes and controls.

Support for Customer Requests:

Utilize analytical tools for customer needs.
Extract and consolidate relevant data for reporting.
Analyze best delivery methods and identify root causes.

Values and Culture Champion:

Model Walmart values and foster a positive culture.
Uphold the highest standards of integrity, ethics, and compliance.
Act as an altruistic servant leader.

Embrace Change - Curiosity & Courage:

Demonstrate curiosity and a growth mindset.
Foster an environment supporting learning, innovation, and intelligent risk-taking.
Exhibit resilience in the face of setbacks.

Digital Transformation & Change:

Seek and implement continuous improvements.
Encourage the team to leverage new digital tools and ways of working.

Deliver for the Customer - Customer Focus:

Put the customer first in all plans.
Apply an omni-merchant mindset and EDLP/EDLC business models consistently.
Adopt a strategic thinking approach considering data, analytics, and customer insights.

Focus on our Associates - Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: - Identify, attract, and retain diverse and inclusive team members. - Build a high-performing team embracing diversity in all forms. - Support diversity goal programs actively.

Collaboration & Influence: - Build strong relationships with team members and business partners. - Work collaboratively and cross-functionally to achieve objectives. - Communicate with energy and positivity to motivate, influence, and inspire commitment and action.

Talent Management: - Create discipline and focus around developing talent. - Promote an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work. - Empower associates and partners to act in the best interest of the customer and company. - Regularly recognize others' contributions and accomplishments.

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, or related field OR 2 years' experience in data analytics, project management, business, or relevant area.

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Analytics - Big Data, Data Analysis and Insights, Statistical Programming Language

Primary Location...
2608 Se J St, BENTONVILLE, AR 72712, United States of America

Job Title: Sr Services Business Analyst - Life Sciences - Remote
Job Description:
Welcome to Veradigm! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Veradigm is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.




Veradigm Life Science

The Veradigm Network is well-positioned to address the unique needs of Life Sciences customers. By leveraging the Veradigm Network, research data and associated insights become both an output of care delivery, as well as additional knowledge to improve quality of care, a true virtuous cycle.

Our portfolio of solutions provides insights using real-world data directly sourced from the Veradigm Network. These solutions can help Life Sciences customers discover timely, actionable real-world evidence to improve patient experience and outcomes, and demonstrate how their products can benefit appropriate patient populations.

Support our Client Success team as they help our Life Sciences clients leverage RWD in the research and commercial ecosystem.

The Senior Services Business Analyst role anticipates and enables the creation of data elements that directly supports the financial, operations and business success of the Client Success Organization.

Are you the right fit?

Are you passionate about how real-world data can help address the unique needs of our life sciences customers? Do you have a life sciences background with strong project management skills? Do you enjoy using your analytical skills to solve problems?

What you will contribute:

Understands the trade and workflow of Life Sciences companies
Facilitates clear communication inter and intra-departmentally to promote collaboration
Assists senior project managers to maintain project documentation
Adapts learning to independently prepare common deliverables needed for business effectiveness
Connects business data elements and articulate impact to variations found in metrics
Demonstrates a complete knowledge base of insight to the Life Sciences Business Unit by anticipating potential business issues before realized
Influences needed decisions to allow for near and long-term resolution to challenges and opportunities presented in the business
Seeks out creative means to thoughtfully support the Client Success Organization in operational and business best practices, ensuring compliance and success
Measures and articulates business benefit(s) and outcome(s)
Initiates tool enhancement design suggestions and scope and sees development through completion and production
Leads the ongoing need to continuous process improvement of the organization and function
Anticipates business trends based on industry knowledge and market climate for preparedness and organizational awareness
Creates creative means to describe and represent compelling business issues to leadership leveraging data accurately with insight and context
Demonstrates flexibility and open to evolving roles and responsibilities as need to support Sales, Client Success, and the Business Unit.

The ideal candidate will have:

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent Technical / Business experience (Required)
4-7 years relevant work experience (Preferred)
Life Sciences background (Required)
Project Management experience (Required)
Understanding of data elements within life sciences and how they move through the ecosystem (Required)
External certification in Project Management (Preferred)
Up to 10% travel may be required

Compliance

Job responsibilities include fostering the Company's compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, adherence to the Code of Conduct and Compliance Program requirements, policies and procedures. Compliance is everyone's responsibility.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
PC skills including spreadsheet, all Microsoft Office Suite applications and database applications
Experience with Salesforce and JIRA (Preferred)
Power BI


Enhancing Lives and Building Careers

Veradigm believes in empowering our associates with the tools and flexibility to bring the best version of themselves to work and to further their professional development. Together, we are In the Network. Interested in learning more?

Take a look at our Culture, Benefits, Early Talent Program, and Additional Openings.

We strongly advocate that our associates receive all CDC recommended vaccinations in prevention of COVID-19.

Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.

Applicants for North American based positions with Veradigm must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Veradigm is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Job Summary: This role will formulate and define system scopes and objectives based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems and industry requirements.




Note: All new hires will travel to Palm Harbor, Florida for a week of new hire orientation.




Qualifications Summary:




The ideal Business Analyst will possess Unemployment Insurance experience. Prior BA experience is desired, however, a qualified candidate has experience in Unemployment Insurance programs along with performance responsibilities at Federal and/or State level will be considered. You will thrive both in an independent and team environment. You must be able to take ownership of projects and complete those projects accurately and efficiently. You must also be able to work with various internal groups and teams and have the ability to manage multiple, simultaneous projects and deadlines.

The ideal candidate for this position is organized; detail oriented, has great communication skills and thrives in a fast-paced environment. You will need to apply these skills in a variety of areas including, but not limited to, business analysis, requirements definition, building test plans, coordinating all resources and stakeholders, setting deadlines, assigning responsibilities, and monitoring, summarizing and communicating the progress of all assigned projects. You will work among a team of software Engineers, Developers, Project Managers and QA staff for support and collaboration of client specific deliverables.




Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyze business and user needs, specifically related to interfaces involving third party or outside systems, document requirements and translate both into proper specifications for each project.
Coordinate and meet with clients and business leaders, as well as working closely with software architects and development teams to ensure that the direction, scope and dependencies are identified and documented.
Possess strong knowledge of both project management and the software development lifecycle (SDLC) of large-scale development projects.
Translate business requirements into concise system requirements for use by the software architects and development teams.
Extensive understanding of multiple functional areas related to complex projects and the ability to identify and quantify business process improvements along with system improvements through the use of technology is critical.
Foster productive communication between technical and non-technical audiences to ensure that technology solutions fulfill the business needs.
Identify, document and diagram business requirements and processes.
Knowledge of project management methodologies and practices.
Assist with validation and testing of interfaces written to the design specification



Requirements

Communication Skills:

Excellent written and oral communication skills
Facilitate team and client meetings effectively
Keep the client and project team well informed of project status, issues and issue mitigation strategies
Resolve and/or escalate issues in a timely fashion
Effectively communicate relevant project information to superiors

Technical:

MS SQL server (2000/2005/2008) and query knowledge is essential
Testing of applications written to the design specifications written.
Ability to track data through the database as it relates to the application
Review of all customer change orders, update requirements documents, and make recommendations regarding the implementation of the request modifications.

PLUS:

Possess a general understanding of application programming, database and system design
Understanding of Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architectures
Ability to analyze system requirements relative to the base software functionality and configuration

Leadership:

Inspire coworkers to attain goals and pursue excellence
Manage the process of innovative change effectively
Identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change

Teamwork:

Consistently acknowledge and appreciate each team member’s contributions
Work with both technical software developers and non-technical state and local government clients to make sure that final deliverables meet client requirements
Coordinate client training with training staff and assist where necessary
Prepare and deliver training updates via webinars

Knowledge and Skills:

Proficient in MS Office to include: Word, Excel, Outlook, Power Point, and Project
Knowledge of relational databases and basic SQL query techniques
Must have experience interfacing with customers, internal managers and staff
Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills
Strong oral and written communication skills with an attention to detail
Strong leadership skills with a proven past to drive results and affect change
Knowledge of the software development life cycle
Bachelor’s Degree in business or related field, or equivalent experience preferred

Travel:

Required travel to visit client sites, attend National Conferences and/or assist in Marketing presentations which are assigned by Manager when appropriate.

SUMMARY

This position is a highly analytical, process driven role that is responsible for leveraging Blue Yonder (previously JDA), COGNOS, and inventory management technology to develop and implement function-specific analytics, solutions development, and process refinements. Requirements may be driven externally from Armada clients, or internally due to needs of the department or the organization as a whole. Additionally, this individual will be responsible for identifying and rectifying opportunities for continuous improvement in the inventory management department. In conjunction, the Inventory Planning Analyst will consistently develop and document functional best practices and SOPs. This individual will also serve as a resident functional expert and resource in the use of Armada’s inventory management system (Blue Yonder) and analytical tools. This individual will also support Managers, Demand Planners, and Supply Planners as deemed necessary to drive favorable departmental results.

INVENTORY MANAGEMENT AND DATA MINING SYSTEMS

Leverage Demand Planning, Supply Planning, and technical expertise to act as “Super-User” and “first line of defense” for all systems tied to the inventory management function, most specifically Blue Yonder Demand and Fulfillment
Provide analysis & recommendations that drive efficiencies, improved performance, and reduction of cost and/or effort within the inventory management team
Utilize data mining tools (COGNOS, Spotfire, Excel) and associated skill sets, to build reports and drive required analysis
Independently assess, troubleshoot, and resolve system and data issues, partnering with department resources and IT as needed
Leverage advanced MS Excel functionality to manipulate data between systems, analyze data, and train other team members
FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Identify opportunities for continuous improvement, develop refinements, and implement across all members of the inventory management team
Develop a deep understanding of department goals and KPIs, and work with department managers to drive improvements
Utilize Supply Planning and Demand Planning expertise in the organization and implementation of departmental initiatives
Develop scalable, sustainable processes, tools, and templates that enable the inventory management team to consistently and quickly deliver results
Document functional best practices, develop SOP’s, and maintain up-to-date organized documentation
Lead training sessions for process and system implementations and improvements; aid in the training of new hires
Engage heavily in development associated with special programs, promotions, or LTO’s
Engage heavily in development associated with product deployment and/or innovative efforts associated with managing inventory within client’s supply chains
Support Manager of Inventory Planning Process in driving strategic departmental evolutionary efforts
Assist in leading all efforts associated with on boarding new or expanded services and/or clients
Support the Manager of Inventory Planning Process to interact with clients during the development and implementation of inventory management specific processes and initiatives
Demonstrate a high degree of organization and clear communication when leading the inventory management team in the development and implementation of planning activities
Demonstrate a high degree of organization in achieving personal results
Provide out-of-office coverage or act as an additional resource for Supply Planning and/or Demand Planning when necessary
Other duties as required

COLLABORATION

Represent the inventory management department as a collaborative liaison and build relationships with internal groups such as IT, PMO, Engineering, Operations, Account Management, Finance, and Business Development
Assume position to lead others without authority when developing and implementing inventory management processes, programs, and initiatives
Demonstrate a high degree of confidence and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders
Coordinate efforts across multiple Armada disciplines when assessing requirements and driving results
Utilize PowerPoint and other associated tools/technology to successfully lead meetings and presentations
Supervisory responsibilities
None
Education and experience requirement

Minimum:

2-5 years of inventory management experience and/or proven mastery of business analytics as it relates to inventory management
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain, or other relevant discipline
Proven track record of success in a Supply Planning or Demand Planning role
Strong analytical abilities, organizational skills, and attention to detail
Experience using inventory management software (i.e. Blue Yonder, SAP, Logility, etc.)
Experience using data mining software to pull data, build reports and make business decisions/recommendations (i.e. COGNOS, Spotfire, Tableau, etc.)
Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills to interact cross-functionally, with higher-level management, and with external clients
Extensive use of Excel
Ability to train others on complex and detailed technical material
Ability to collaboratively organize and lead a team, via managing without authority
Ability to set priorities and make decisions in a dynamic work environment
Action oriented, with good problem solving, analytical, and math skills

Preferred:

Experience in both Supply Planning and Demand Planning
Experience in product redistribution
Experience planning product with shelf life (i.e. perishables such as food)
Experience planning product with varied lead times (i.e. international as well as domestic suppliers)
Experience planning promotional product and limited time offerings
Experience in project management

Job Title: Trauma Data Analyst (FT, Days) - Jefferson Torresdale Campus
Job Description:
Under the supervision of the Trauma Program Director and Nurse Registrars establishes and maintains efficient operations of the Trauma Registry to meet the Pennsylvania Trauma System Foundation and other data collection and other reporting requirements.

He/she provides additional support to the Trauma Program through other delegated coordination and secretarial responsibilities.

Identifies trauma cases, using established criteria by retrieving appropriate information for inclusion into trauma registry.

Reviews the medical record both concurrently and retrospectively to abstract information for inclusion in the Trauma Registry.

Compiles and submits designated reports and summaries according to established deadlines and to assist in efficient and effective program operation.

Abstracts data concurrently for the National Trauma Bank and for the Trauma Quality Improvement Program (TQIP).

Maintains accurate records to ensure complete and organized trauma database.

Participates in the Performance Improvement process by attending and participating in trauma meeting as assigned

Participates in PTSF Fall Conference, other additional PTSF forums, and the Annual TQIP Meeting as directed by the Trauma Program Director

Attends trauma related continuing education in-services to maintain knowledge base, required to complete at least 8 contact hours annual as evidenced by certificates of attendance.

Completes the beginner Trauma Registry course within 1 year of hire and completes an ICD-10 refresher course every five years

Completes the Abbreviated Injury Scale Course within 1 year of hire

Certified Specialist in Trauma Registries (CSTR) required within 2 years of hire

Completes monthly TQIP educational sessions and completes testing

Other duties and responsibilities not specified here that may be required for the proper maintenance and function of the Trauma Registry and support of the Trauma Program

Role is Perfect for a LPN or PCT. Knowledge of clinical terminology a plus.

Education: High school or post high school training in anatomy and physiology, medical terminology, ICD 10 coding preferred. RHIA, RHIT or CSTR or equivalent in training/experience preferred

Experience: computer skills, International Classification of disease (ICD) 10 coding experience. Former LPN, PCT preferred.

Licensure/Certification/Registration Requirements: CSTR/CAISS certification preferred.

Since this position will require the selected candidate to engage in regular contact with children in the form of care, guidance, supervision or training, you will be required to meet the requirements of the Child Protective Services Act, including the Pennsylvania State Police criminal background check, the Pennsylvania Department of Welfare child abuse criminal background clearance, and an FBI finger print based federal criminal records check. The selected candidate will not be allowed to commence working until all three (3) are completed satisfactorily.

Covid Vaccination is a requirement for employment at Jefferson for employees working at Jefferson’s clinical entities or at the University. If you are not currently vaccinated you will be required to receive the vaccination prior to hire date if you are offered employment, unless you request and receive an approved medical or religious exemption from Jefferson.

Jefferson includes Thomas Jefferson University and Jefferson Health, a dynamic university and health system with broad reach across the Delaware Valley. Jefferson is the second largest employer in Philadelphia and the largest health system in Philadelphia based on total licensed beds.

Through the merger of Thomas Jefferson University and Philadelphia University in 2017, our University includes ten colleges and four schools. We are an NCAA Division II university and an R2 national doctoral university offering undergraduate and graduate-level programs that provide students with a forward-thinking education in architecture, business, design, engineering, fashion and textiles, health, medicine and social science.

Jefferson Health, the clinical arm of Thomas Jefferson University, has grown from a three-hospital academic health center in 2015, to an 18-hospital health system through mergers and combinations that include hospitals at Abington Health, Aria Health, Kennedy Health, Magee Rehabilitation and Einstein Healthcare Network. We have over 50 outpatient and urgent care centers; ten Magnet®-designated hospitals (recognized by the ANCC for nursing excellence); the NCI-designated Sidney Kimmel Cancer Center (one of only 70 in the country and one of only two in the region); and one of the largest faculty-based telehealth networks in the country. In 2021, Jefferson Health became the sole owner of HealthPartners Plan, a not-for-profit health maintenance organization in Southeastern Pennsylvania. We are the first health system regionally to create an aligned payer-provider partnership.

Jefferson’s mission, vision and values create an organization that attracts the best and the brightest students, faculty, staff, and healthcare professionals, as well as the most visionary leaders to drive exceptional results.

OUR MISSION: We improve lives.
OUR VISION: Reimagining health, education and discovery to create unparalleled value
OUR VALUES: Put People First, Be Bold & Think Differently and Do the Right Thing

As an employer, Jefferson maintains a commitment to provide equal access to employment. Jefferson values diversity and encourages applications from women, members of minority groups, LGBTQ individuals, disabled individuals, and veterans.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Real World Data (RWD) Insights
Job Description:
How you will help
As a Senior Analyst, Real World Data (RWD) Insights you will provide exceptional healthcare data analytics expertise for clients and colleagues in support of sales opportunities to license data. You will conduct discovery and translate clients’ research and business questions into actionable analyses to demonstrate data feasibility by leveraging the largest healthcare data ecosystem in the US. In collaboration with colleagues, you will identify and educate clients on the data suppliers in the HealthVerity Marketplace (HVM) that capture the necessary data elements to conduct RWD-based studies and produce regulatory-grade real world evidence (RWE).

What you will do
Efficiently query multiple data types (medical and pharmacy claims, EMR, lab, chargemaster) using SQL to identify populations of interest in HVM data and assess using univariate analysis and data investigations
Empower clients to generate RWE utilizing best-in-class observational research by conducting pre-sale feasibility analyses of varying breadth and depth
Provide clients with RWD training, analytic guidance, and use case support in the post-sale phase
Develop and communicate technical, clinical, operational, and business specifications to internal and external teams
Work cross-functionally to support operational processes to deliver data licensing projects on time and with accuracy
Contribute to the development and maintenance of internal documentation, code templates, analytics automation, and other process improvement initiatives to support internal team efficiency, effectiveness, and growth

How success will be defined
Creatively and strategically position HealthVerity to win against the competition by building trust and credibility as a subject matter expert (SME)
Take ownership of pre- and post-sale projects and drive to completion
Dedicate 5-10% of working hours to team and individual improvement
Ensure minimal errors in presales feasibility and data requirements for delivery

Required skills and experience
Graduate degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Clinical Informatics, or related quantitative field
At least 3 years experience in a consultative, client-facing role
At least 3 years experience using SQL, programming against large relational databases leveraging interoperably-linked, patient-level data at scale
Healthcare data expert across various data types (e.g. open/closed claims, inpatient/ambulatory EMR, commercial labs, social determinants, etc.) and codified healthcare data standards (e.g. ICD, CPT, HCPCS, CVX, LOINC, NUCC, NPPES, etc.)
Experience evaluating fit-for-purpose data and implementing research protocols
Experienced applying RWD to specific healthcare and life sciences-related research questions and use cases, such as RWE/epidemiology, HEOR, R&D, commercial, public health

Desired skills and experience
Exposure to a wide range of healthcare industry business segments (pharma, biotech, government, consulting, healthcare payer/provider)
Evangelist and champion of RWD/RWE
Skilled at educating, presenting, and demonstrating analytical concepts to internal and external audiences
Strong communicator (both verbally and in writing) with the ability to translate client needs into actionable data insights
Experience supporting business development activities
Experience owning and managing projects with the ability to identify and mitigate risk to intended outcomes
Team player who takes initiative and works collaboratively with colleagues across all levels of the organization
Highly organized, consultative, and proactive critical thinker/problem solver
Committed to personal and professional continuous development
Exceptional attention to detail
Experience coding in Python
Thrives in a rapidly-changing, fast paced environment


Base salary for the role is commensurate with experience and can range between $80,000 - 130,000 + annual bonus opportunity.

Hiring Locations
While HealthVerity does support remote work with quarterly travel to our Philadelphia headquarters, our strong preference is to hire team members in the areas below as well as approved states in the Eastern Time Zone. Expansion beyond these markets will occur only when necessary.

Boston, Massachusetts
New York City, New York
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Baltimore, Maryland
Washington D.C
Charlotte, North Carolina
Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina
Atlanta, Georgia

Approved States in the Eastern Time Zone include: CT, DE, FL, GA, IN, MA, MD, MI NC, NJ, NY, OH, PA, RI, TN, and VA.

About HealthVerity
HealthVerity synchronizes transformational technologies with the nation’s largest healthcare and consumer data ecosystem to power previously unattainable outcomes and fundamentally advance the science. We offer a comprehensive, yet flexible approach, based on the foundational elements of Identity, Privacy, Governance and Exchange (IPGE), that synchronizes unparalleled Identity management with built-in Privacy compliance and Governance, providing the ability to discover and Exchange a near limitless combination of data at a record pace. Together with our partners in life sciences, government and insurance, we are Synchronizing the Science. To learn more about HealthVerity, visit healthverity.com.

Why you'll love working here

We are making a difference – Our technology is at the forefront of some of the biggest healthcare challenges in the world.
We are one team – Our people define our culture and always will. We take time out to celebrate each other at the end of every week through company-wide shout outs, and acknowledge the value that each of us adds towards our greater mission. Come share all you have to offer.
We are learners – Every team member is continually learning, no matter if we've been in a role for one year or much longer. We are committed to learning and implementing what is best for our clients, partners, and each other.

Benefits & Perks
Compensation: competitive base salary & annual bonus opportunity (for non-commissioned roles)
Benefits: comprehensive benefits with coverage on Day 1, medical, dental, vision, 401k, stock options
Flexible location: our HQ is in Philadelphia. We offer both hybrid roles and those with quarterly travel.
Generous PTO: Take time off as needed, targeted at 4 weeks per year, including vacation, personal and sick time, plus paid maternity and paternity leave.
Comprehensive and individualized onboarding: mentorship program, departmental talks, and a library of resources are available beginning day 1 for each new team member to minimize the stress of starting a new job
Professional development: biweekly 1:1s, hands-on leadership that is goal-and growth-oriented for each team member, and an annual budget to support professional development pursuits

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Job Title: Post-Doctoral Associate - Data Analytics of Labor Markets
Job Description:
Post-Doctoral Associate - Data Analytics of Labor Markets

GSPIA-Office of the Dean - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (23007578)



A major societal shift to clean energy comes with an analogous redistribution of fossil fuel workers to new opportunities. How can we achieve this transition justly? Solutions require insights into social, economic, and career limitations that limit today's fossil fuel workers. To address these multi-disciplinary questions, the Graduate School of Public and International Affairs (GSPIA) at the University of Pittsburgh (Pitt) has an opening for a 2-year post-doctoral associate position in the Data Analytics of Labor Markets beginning in September 2024.

The project investigates the labor market opportunities and barriers in the transition to more diversified economies with a focus on a Just Transition for fossil fuel workers to other employment opportunities. Knowledge from this project will inform policies that support a Just Transition. The post-doctoral associate will analyze workers' skills using several large public and proprietary databases, using tools from computational social science and social sciences. The applicant should be near the completion of their Ph.D. in Computational Social Sciences, Economics, Political Science, Sociology, Public Policy, or related fields and comfortable with languages such as Python and/or R. The candidate must complete their Ph.D. prior to the commencement of this post-doc associate position.

The postdoc will be working with the interdisciplinary team led by Prof. Shanti Gamper-Rabindran (GSPIA, Economics, Law, Pitt), Prof. Michael Aklin (College of Management, EPFL – Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne) and Prof. Morgan R. Frank (Department of Informatics and Networked Systems, School of Computing and Information, Pitt). The team publishes evidence-based research to inform public policies to support workers' transition within more diversified economies.

We are committed to working with the post-doc and our students to conduct research that will be published in well-regarded journals and that will inform public policy. We envision that the post-doc will not only pursue our plan of research, but also take the lead in related research directions and gain experience in jointly planning new research directions and in jointly pursuing research funding opportunities. The team's collaborative nature and its track record of securing funding and producing interdisciplinary publications that provide guidance on public policy provides a positive environment for a post-doc to further hone their skills for pursuing academic or/and policy work.

The annual salary for this role will be in the $58,000-$60,000 range.

Faculty members' related research in the intersection of labor markets, energy and the environment can be viewed at:

https//shanti1.weebly.com
https://sites.pitt.edu/~mrfrank/
https://www.epfl.ch/labs/pasu/

To apply, please upload the following materials to University of Pittsburgh Talent Center: (1) a cover letter detailing your research experience on the analysis of labor skills and your use of computational analysis or/and econometrics to examine labor skills; (2) CV including the link to your professional website or google scholar page (if applicable); (3) two research papers. including at least one for which you are the lead author; (4) Name, position and email of your three letter writers.

Please request your referees to kindly send their confidential letters of recommendation to Prof. Gamper-Rabindran (shanti1@pitt.edu)




To guarantee full consideration, your application should be submitted by November 27, 2023, but we will continue to review applications until the position is filled.



Interested applicants should submit: (1) a cover letter detailing your research experience on the analysis of labor skills and your use of computational analysis or/and econometrics to examine labor skills; (2) CV including the link to your professional website or google scholar page (if applicable); (3) two research papers. including at least one for which you are the lead author; (4) Name, position and email of your three letter writers. Please request your referees to kindly send their confidential letters of recommendation to Prof. Gamper-Rabindran (shanti1@pitt.edu) To guarantee full consideration, your application should be submitted by November 27, 2023, but we will continue to review applications until the position is filled.

Job Description

Digital Platforms & Engineering Finance (DPE)

Position: Financial Analyst III

Hiring Manager: Sr Manager, Finance

Location: Hybrid Waltham, MA; Carlsbad, CA; or Pittsburgh, PA

How you’ll make an impact!

This individual will work with their direct leadership to drive Thermo Fisher Scientific’s planning and analytics and labor charge back process across our DPE and IT Shared Services teams. The ideal candidate has a consistent track record as an experienced high potential talent demonstrating drive, ambition, financial and analytical acuity, and emotional intelligence.

This position will partner with the Finance leadership team and business by bringing strong capabilities in forecasting and analysis, trend identification, and insight generation to support impactful reporting, along with effective process management. They will link to finance colleagues across Global IT Finance to ensure alignment financially and around core results for Corporate FP&A.

1. Providing financial planning and analysis support to the Digital Engineering and the Global IT Shared Service organizations around monthly/quarterly reporting, and planning/forecasting mechanisms.

2. Developing the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and monthly forecasts; conducting variance analysis; preparing AR financials and other ad hoc analysis related to labor.

3. Completing key month-end close processes and post-close reporting for operating expenses.

4. Run labor chargeback process for all of IT shared services.

5. Delivering operational improvements to drive efficiency and customer ease of use.

What will you do!
Partnership: Ability to build organizational relationships with customers, peers and operating partners.
Thought Leadership: Ability to independently make logical assumptions, identify trends, and effectively utilize data to evaluate business performance.
Financial Domain: Proficiency in the following areas: financial analysis and reporting, forecasting, process controls, and accounting knowledge specifically related to capitalization of software development activities.
Process Acuity: Strong skills with MS Excel (management and synthesis of large data sets) and MS PowerPoint (compelling storytelling), along with Oracle, HFM, and COGNOS (financial system proficiency).
Adaptability: Ability to work cross-functionally with individuals and teams from different areas and drive continuous operational improvement in daily activities.
How will you get here?
High Potential Talent: A strong Financial Analyst with a proven track record as a top talent demonstrating consistent performance, drive, flexibility and financial acuity.
Leadership: Able to execute key financial processes and provide positive relationship with finance colleagues and business leaders to succeed against goals
Balance: Effectively balance/flex between performing day-to-day finance responsibilities, while partnering on the operational aspects of business processes to execute on key priorities of the finance team.
Results-Oriented: Able to exceed goals, implement consistently, and deliver outstanding results; shown ability to lead multiple projects and/or results simultaneously and partner with across teams in a fast-paced environment.
Subject Matter Authority: Be a go-to person for areas of ownership.
Data-Focused: Acquire and analyze data and use it to drive your forecasting and identification of risks and opportunities of financial results vs plan.
Passion: Demonstrate a passion for the customer experience, culture, mission, and vision, and how digital can be used to improve operations. Dedication to continuous learning, career progression and development, and seeking stretch opportunities.
Innovative: Challenges the status quo of core processes and uses prior finance experience to drive innovative solutions and daily efficiency.
Communication: Clear and concise written, verbal and social skills.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in a Finance or Accounting role.

Job Title: Associate Data Scientist (Analyst C/D)(Palliative Research Center)
Job Description:
University Overview
The University of Pennsylvania, the largest private employer in Philadelphia, is a world-renowned leader in education, research, and innovation. This historic, Ivy League school consistently ranks among the top 10 universities in the annual U.S. News & World Report survey. Penn has 12 highly-regarded schools that provide opportunities for undergraduate, graduate and continuing education, all influenced by Penn’s distinctive interdisciplinary approach to scholarship and learning. As an employer Penn has been ranked nationally on many occasions with the most recent award from Forbes who named Penn one of America’s Best Large Employers in 2023.
Penn offers a unique working environment within the city of Philadelphia. The University is situated on a beautiful urban campus, with easy access to a range of educational, cultural, and recreational activities. With its historical significance and landmarks, lively cultural offerings, and wide variety of atmospheres, Philadelphia is the perfect place to call home for work and play.
The University offers a competitive benefits package that includes excellent healthcare and tuition benefits for employees and their families, generous retirement benefits, a wide variety of professional development opportunities, supportive work and family benefits, a wealth of health and wellness programs and resources, and much more.
Posted Job Title
Associate Data Scientist (Analyst C/D)(Palliative Research Center)
Job Profile Title
Data Analyst C
Job Description Summary
The Palliative and Advanced Illness Research Center is seeking a research data scientist (data analyst) to support the Center’s research efforts in training, validating, and deploying clinical prediction models. The research data scientist must demonstrate a strong understanding of data extraction and cleaning, statistical learning concepts, and the ability to implement these in code, ideally in the healthcare setting, and be able to discuss both technical requirements and study design considerations effectively with collaborators within and external to the PAIR Center. The research data scientist will report to Dr. Gary Weissman and will be embedded within his project teams to develop, document, and execute data and analytic workflows. This individual will also be responsible for preparing exhibits and methods descriptions for grants and publications on behalf of Dr. Weissman; collaborating with data scientists and data engineers in the health system to transition clinical prediction models into deployment; and using best practices for computational research including use of version control, detailed documentation of code and methods, and supporting efforts to promote transparency and reproducibility with open-source tools.
Job Description
Job Responsibilities
The Palliative and Advanced Illness Research Center is seeking a research data scientist (data analyst) to support the Center’s research efforts in training, validating, and deploying clinical prediction models. The research data scientist must demonstrate a strong understanding of data extraction and cleaning, statistical learning concepts, and the ability to implement these in code, ideally in the healthcare setting, and be able to discuss both technical requirements and study design considerations effectively with collaborators within and external to the PAIR Center. The research data scientist will report to Dr. Gary Weissman and will be embedded within his project teams to develop, document, and execute data and analytic workflows. This individual will also be responsible for preparing exhibits and methods descriptions for grants and publications on behalf of Dr. Weissman; collaborating with data scientists and data engineers in the health system to transition clinical prediction models into deployment; and using best practices for computational research including use of version control, detailed documentation of code and methods, and supporting efforts to promote transparency and reproducibility with open-source tools.
DUTIES:
Data Analyst C:
Develop and refine data queries from large health care databases using MS and Spark SQL
Train and validate clinical prediction models using R.
Analyze results of predictive modeling studies and communicate results with team members.
Clearly document and maintain code in a collaborative environment using version control systems (e.g. git and GitHub)
Develop figures and tables based on data analyses to support manuscript publications and grant submissions.
Attend research team meetings.
Data Analyst D:
Perform all duties as listed above.
Manage and oversee the work of students, trainees, and research assistants.
Develop and publish open-source software packages based on research activities.
Maintain relationships and collaborate with data scientists and data engineers in hospital operations and other research groups.
Contingent Upon Funding.
Qualifications
Data Analyst C
Bachelor of Science and 2 to 3 years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Master's degree preferred.
Preferred:
1-3 years of data analysis experience in healthcare research or a related area.
Experience processing data using SQL and analyzing data using R.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Data Analyst D:
Bachelor of Science, and 3 to 5 years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Master's degree preferred.
Preferred:
3-5 years of data analysis experience in healthcare research or a related area.
Experience processing data using SQL and analyzing data using R.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Preferred:
Experience with version control systems (e.g. git and GitHub), Python, and working in a Linux environment.
Experience training and validating prediction models using statistical learning and data science techniques.
Experience with web development frameworks such as a React.js.

Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Department / School
Perelman School of Medicine

$51,824.00 - $123,975.00 Annual Rate

Health, Life, and Flexible Spending Accounts: Penn offers comprehensive medical, prescription, behavioral health, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits to protect you and your family’s health and welfare. You can also use flexible spending accounts to pay for eligible health care and dependent care expenses with pre-tax dollars.
Tuition: Take advantage of Penn's exceptional tuition benefits. You, your spouse, and your dependent children can get tuition assistance here at Penn. Your dependent children are also eligible for tuition assistance at other institutions.
Retirement: Penn offers generous retirement plans to help you save for your future. Penn’s Basic, Matching, and Supplemental retirement plans allow you to save for retirement on a pre-tax or Roth basis. Choose from a wide variety of investment options through TIAA and Vanguard.
Time Away from Work: Penn provides you with a substantial amount of time away from work during the course of the year. This allows you to relax, take vacations, attend to personal affairs, recover from illness or injury, spend time with family—whatever your personal needs may be.

If you apply when you’re newly hired, you won’t have to provide proof of good health or be subject to underwriting requirements. Eligible family members must always provide proof of good health and are subject to underwriting.
Wellness and Work-life Resources: Penn is committed to supporting our faculty and staff as they balance the competing demands of work and personal life. That’s why we offer a wide variety of programs and resources to help you care for your health, your family, and your work-life balance.
Professional and Personal Development: Penn provides an array of resources to help you advance yourself personally and professionally.
University Resources: As a member of the Penn community, you have access to a wide range of University resources as well as cultural and recreational activities. Take advantage of the University’s libraries and athletic facilities, or visit our arboretum and art galleries. There’s always something going on at Penn, whether it’s a new exhibit at the Penn Museum, the latest music or theater presentation at the Annenberg Center, or the Penn Relays at Franklin Field to name just a few examples. As a member of the Penn community, you’re right in the middle of the excitement—and you and your family can enjoy many of these activities for free.
Discounts and Special Services: From arts and entertainment to transportation and mortgages, you'll find great deals for University faculty and staff. You can also enjoy substantial savings on other goods and services such as new cars from Ford and General Motors, cellular phone service plans, movie tickets, and admission to theme parks.
Flexible Work Hours: Flexible work options offer creative approaches for completing work while promoting balance between work and personal commitments. These approaches involve use of non-traditional work hours, locations, and/or job structures.
Penn Home Ownership Services: Penn offers a forgivable loan for eligible employees interested in buying a home or currently residing in West Philadelphia, which can be used for closing costs or home improvements.
Adoption Assistance: Penn will reimburse eligible employees on qualified expenses in connection with the legal adoption of an eligible child, such as travel or court fees, for up to two adoptions in your household.

Data Protection Analyst

What Information Security and Risk contributes to Cardinal Health

Information Technology oversees the effective development, delivery, and operation of computing and information services. This function anticipates, plans, and delivers Information Technology solutions and strategies that enable operations and drive business value.

Information Security and Risk develops, implements, and enforces security controls to protect the organization's technology assets from intentional or inadvertent modification, disclosure, or destruction. This job family develops system back-up and disaster recovery plans. Information Technology also conducts incident response, threat management, vulnerability scanning, virus management and intrusion detection and completes risk assessments.

Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management. Backed by nearly 100 years of experience, with more than 50,000 employees in nearly 60 countries, Cardinal Health ranks among the top 20 on the Fortune 500.

We currently have a full-time job opening for a seasoned Data Protection Analyst. This position can be either at our Dublin center or remote.

Job Overview:

The Data Protection Analyst will report to the Manager of the Data Protection Team at Cardinal Health. The bulk of the role will be focused on performing event remediation and the development of business-facing data protection processes. This analyst will also support the data protection engineers in developing and maintaining technology solutions to protect data and will receive direction on various initiatives from the Manager. The analyst will have direct contact with Data Protection tools including Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB), GCP BigQuery, Proof-of-Concept Technologies and ultimately newer technologies to be adopted and operationalized by the team. This data protection analyst will also play a role as the SDM program is developed and continually aligned with the changing technological landscape as well as industry evolutions and trends.

Responsibilities include the following:

Perform analysis and remediation of event/incident traffic within multiple data protection platforms.
Continually look for opportunities to reduce the false positive rates in existing or new data protection controls.
Support the manager of data protection in the development of business support processes as part of relevant projects.
Review policies and the configuration of data protection tools to refine rulesets.
Collaborate with data protection team members and other IT teams to build and deploy security and monitoring controls for databases and develop data at rest processes for O365.
Assist data protection engineers with Google BigQuery reporting and analysis.
Determine current and anticipate future event remediation needs and support the development of security controls in collaboration with the data protection team.
Aid in educating business teams and application leaders on data identification, secure handling, storage, and transfer of sensitive data. This will be a joint effort with other data protection team members.
Assist the manager of data protection in streamlining data at rest remediation.
Support the technical lead and manager in collaboration across Information Security and Data Analytics teams to aid in the development, growth, and evolution of the SDM Program while advocating for Data Protection tools and techniques.


Required Qualifications:

Prior experience with industry DLP, CASB, data encryption and monitoring tools, and data protection best practices.
Demonstrated experience with incident remediation automation and data at rest process development, especially within O365 and GCP environments.
Demonstrated Information Security understanding and specifically industry best practices for the development of data protection processes.
One or more Information Security Certifications preferred: CISSP, CSSLP, CISM, CCSP, GSLC, GSEC, CISA, SSCP.
Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent work experience.
5-7 years of experience in related field

What is expected of you and others at this level?

Contributes to the development of policies and procedures related to data protection.
Supports the development of technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organizational goals.
Continues to support the development of sensitive data processes to improve Cardinal Health enterprise security posture.
Provides general guidance and best practices with respect to remediation opportunities.
Recommends new practices, processes, metrics, or models.
Acts as a mentor to less experienced colleagues performing event analysis.

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Job Title: Product Analyst, HH IT Data & Analytics, US Data Services (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Job Description

The Information Technology organization partners with colleagues across the business to help serve our patients and customers around the world. One of the key priorities for the company is a significant focus on Data and its utilization as a Strategic asset to drive insights-driven decisions. The opportunity to accelerate our time to insights hinges on our ability to integrate, enrich and govern our disparate and evolving data sources, at speed and scale. The Human Health (HH) IT Data and Analytics team’s mission is to focus on driving these capabilities to increase utilization of data within the organization.

How will you invent the future?

We have an opportunity for an enterprising data and analytics professional who will thrive in a landscape and technology environment which is continuously evolving, requiring an individual who is collaborative, self-motivated, takes accountability and drives results.

The Data Product Analyst, HH IT Data & Analytics will be responsible for activities supporting the development, enhancement, adoption, and utilization of commercial data supporting various US Market functions such as Sales, Marketing, Market Access, Patient Engagement, Strategy partnerships and Alliances. Reporting to the Product Manager, HH IT Data & Analytics, US Data Services, this role will involve collaborating with various stakeholder groups across business and IT to gather, evaluate, prioritize, develop, and successfully deliver data products and related enhancements. This role will also have significant interaction with our partners, suppliers, and various data and technology providers.

Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Leading the efforts to capture, analyze, document, and socialize actionable requirements for new data assets or enhancements to existing data assets.

Maintaining and prioritizing a healthy backlog of well-formed epics, features and user stories which align with the overall roadmap and serve as requirements for the delivery squad(s).

Translating and documenting the business needs and requirements into technical specifications with sufficient depth and completeness of details that meet the company’s Agile SDLC and documentation standards.

Performing technical and data analysis as required for activities such as substantiating requirements, identifying existing data or technology solutions, and in responding to inquiries from business and technical teams.

Participating in Agile ceremonies and representing assigned scope effectively to facilitate the end-to-end execution and deployment of desired scope for successful product increment releases.

Partnering with globally distributed team members including but not limited to scrum masters, technical lead(s) and development team to manage high-quality product delivery leveraging Agile SDLC methodology.

Serving as the subject matter expert in the assigned areas and effectively representing information regarding the availability, quality and fit of data assets for various IT and stakeholders.

Applying value- and risk-based decision making to complex problems and consulting with relevant subject matter advisors as needed to inform the decision.

Operating with integrity and ensuring adherence with organization policies, quality assurance and data protection processes.

Partnering with the Data Operations team to proactively raise data load concerns and minimize downstream disruptions.

Tracking, monitoring, documenting, and communicating status, metadata, and metrics on a regular and as needed basis to stakeholders.

Education Minimum Requirement:

Bachelor’s degree

Qualifications:

6+ years working experience in a delivery or implementation role within the Data and Analytics space.

Prior experience and demonstrable knowledge of Life Sciences / Pharmaceutical commercial data domains.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to quickly establish credibility and trust with a variety of stakeholders.

Demonstrable skills in gathering, analyzing, and documenting data requirements and technical specifications with excellent writing skills.

Technical proficiency in data analysis using SQL and at least one other programming language such as Python or R.

Prior working experience with full lifecycle implementation in one or more of the following: data management processes, data warehouse/data lake implementation, data modeling, ETL Tools or advanced SQL.

Prior working experience leading requirements sessions with clients and project teams.

Preferred Experience Skills:

Hands-on experience in cloud data platforms, preferably AWS.

Solid understanding of one or more data domains such as claims, electronic health records, or digital.

Experience with metadata management and working with a Data Governance tool, preferably Collibra.

Experience with agile development methodologies and best practices.

Job Description

Description

As the nation's largest producer of clean, carbon-free energy, Constellation is a company purposely-built to meet the challenges of the climate crisis. Constellation has been the leader in clean energy production for more than a decade and we are growing our company and capabilities. Now, we're accelerating, speeding our low-carbon or no-carbon power to more people in more places, day, and night, providing our customers and communities with options to buy, manage and use energy as part of their decarbonization mission. The race is on to confront the climate crisis and Constellation is ready to meet the challenge. Come join us as we lead energy, together.

Constellation has been the leader in carbon-free energy production for more than a decade, and generates 50% more clean, carbon-free electricity than any other company in America. We're generating power 24/7 with the nation's largest emission-free nuclear energy fleet, providing enough clean energy to power 15 million homes. Constellation offers customers a range of clean, zero-carbon energy solutions to help reduce their carbon footprint and achieve their sustainability goals.

We are committed to advancing diversity, equity and inclusion and believe in attracting, retaining, and advancing employees who will best serve and represent our customers, partners, and communities. We provide a workplace that ensures mutual respect, where each individual has the opportunity to grow and contribute at their greatest potential. Constellation will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build, and power a successful career.

TOTAL REWARDS

Constellation offers a wide range of benefits and rewards, designed to help our employees thrive professionally and personally. In addition to highly competitive salaries, we offer a bonus program, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase program; comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits, including a robust wellness program; paid time off for vacation, holidays, and sick days; and much more.

Expected salary range of $110,700 to $123,000, varies based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits package that includes bonus and 401(k).




PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

This position has a unique blend of business and financial analysis, reporting, and relationship management within the Chief Information Officer’s (CIO) Strategy Enablement organization. Lead and perform support activities for Strategic Vendor Management Office (SVMO) which sets and drives the standards and processes with the focus on operational execution, governs and oversees the contractual, financial, and operational performance of multiple Strategic Partners (SPs). Build and maintain relationships with SPs, Constellation IT Service Delivery, and supporting organizations to deliver high-quality IT services within a risk managed environment.

Perform detailed analysis and prepare comprehensive reports/charts/graphs to support business operations. Conduct complex modeling, forecasting, trending, variance analysis, and other general financial and operational analysis. Track, maintain, analyze, and provide current information on operational scorecards and/or service level agreements (SLAs). Support the design, development and implementation of digital technology and automation related to our data collection, analysis, and presentation processes.

PRIMARY DUTIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Lead the Financial Services function:

Ensure financial adherence to the contractual terms and conditions. Support organizational studies, research, and initiatives that could potentially improve operations and/or result in cost reductions.

Deliver a flexible consumption model able to support the changing needs of the business, provide on-demand spend analysis, administer consistent change request process, track savings, validate accuracy and timeliness of invoice submissions, develop, and maintain an innovation program, and sustainment and continuous improvement activities related to Management Model core functional processes.

Compliance & Oversight: Development and implementation of program financial processes (service fee credits, accruals, invoicing) and procedures that support oversight, conform with financial policies, and support auditing. Serve as liaison between Finance, IT Service Delivery leads, Accounting, Supply, and external vendors on a day-to-day basis for program related financial inquiries. Maintain strong relationships with external vendor administrative personnel in Finance, Accounting, Supply, and IT Service Delivery, ensuring adherence to contractual terms.
Financial Planning & Analysis: Lead development of forecast and Long-Range Plan (LRP) outsourcing cost for IT Strategic Partnering Program (SPP); determining and communicating projections in accordance with contractual terms. Manage the delivery of key program metrics and information supporting audit request, benchmarking, cost, and resources for IT senior leadership, business office, and portfolio owners.
New Business Valuation: Collaborate with Finance and IT Business Office to construct business cases, obtain funding authorization, and manage project implementation budget for outsourcing initiatives. Lead cross functional teams through the development and implementation of program processes.
Data Analytics and Reporting Services: Perform detailed analysis and reporting in support of business operations for the SVMO which governs and oversees the contractual, financial, and operational performance of multiple SPs. Develop models depicting trends and projections that are translated into analytical information for business stakeholders. Track, maintain, analyze, and provide current information related to operational performance. Develop and maintain various reports/charts/graphs.
Financial Services: Lead performance measures with related financial impacts e.g. Credits/Earn Backs. Work in conjunction with internal organizations to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are in place to provide SPP financial information as required.
Innovation Management: Lead the contractual innovation framework to drive innovation and continuous improvement. Effectively leverage the SPs’ capabilities to meet Constellation IT’s strategic objectives; ensures the SPs’ performance continuously improves throughout the term of the services and across all Constellation IT’s business units.
Support of Contract and Performance Services: Work collaboratively with IT SVMO Performance Lead on performance measures with related operational impacts e.g. KPIs/CPIs. Works in conjunction with internal organizations to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are in place to provide SPP performance information as required.
Tools and Reporting Automation and Continuous Improvement: Work with internal and external organizations to develop tracking and reporting mechanisms to provide multi-dimensional views of financial data. Drive continuous improvement through the design, development and implementation of digital scorecards and dashboards. Identify opportunities to automate manual processes and drive self-service reporting.

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related discipline and typically 5 to 8 years experience in Information Technology or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel to retrieve and analyze data in support of business needs.
“Tech Savvy” - Able to leverage technology to solve business problems with proficiency with specialized business technologies (Power BI and other MS development tools).
Ability to provide in-depth analysis analytical and statistical problem solving, financial and business analysis.
Comprehensive knowledge of the practices, procedures, and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis) benchmarking and compliance. Ability to analyze organizational data and complex problems, interpret and recommend alternative courses of action.
Strong leadership, organizational, and project management skills.
Excellent writing skills, as well as excellent written and oral presentation and communications skills.
Strong emotional intelligence, including a demonstrated ability to manage confidential, sensitive, or proprietary information in a discreet and professional manner.
Ability to navigate/build relationships and to collaborate at all levels across the organization.
Ability to build consensus, find common ground, and influence outcomes.
Strong initiative, with self-drive and ability to independently manage time, priorities, and deadlines.
Flexible and comfortable navigating through ambiguity or shifting priorities.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

A minimum of 8 or more years of relevant experience in IT or a business area performing financial activities.
Graduate degree
Demonstrated experience performing vendor management with outsourcing agreements and associated operational processes.
Financial and contractual acumen and negotiation skills
Proficiency with MS 365 Collaboration tools (SharePoint, Teams)
